payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Alpaca wool to make sweaters, coats, shawls, etc. for sale

loans.name: Danelia

texts.es:
Daniela Ramirez is a woman business owner with her own convenience store located in the city the of León, specifically in the village of El Sauce.

For two years she has been earning her living in her own convenience store, a store she has stocked little by little with a growing variety of products over the years. Mrs. Ramirez currently faces the need to invest in the purchase of her products. Since she has few resources she wisely turns to Ceprodel for loans which allow her to improve her economic situation and move ahead toward fulfilling her dreams of being an important merchant in the village of El Sauce.

Mrs. Rosales also needs to invest in the purchase of soft drinks, juices and water. In order to fill all of these needs she has turned to Ceprodel. Ceprodel has not denied her requests but has provided her with loans she has been wise about investing in the purchase of her products and in savings for improvements to her home. Her credit record is 8 loans over a year and a half.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Danelia Ramirez es una dama poseedora de un negocio propio de pulpería ubicado en la ciudad de León específicamente en el pueblo de El Sauce.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a tener su propia pulpería la cual la ha venido surtiendo de productos poco a poco a medida que van transcurriendo los años. Una necesidad que atraviesa la señora R. es que necesita invertir en la compra de sus productos y además de ser de escasos recursos, muy sabiamente acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan mejorar su condición económica y así salir adelante para cumplir sus sueños de ser una gran comerciante en el pueblo de El Sauce.

Otra necesidad de la señora Rosales es que debe invertir en la compra de las gaseosas, jugos y agua. Para suplir todas estas necesidades ha recurrido a Ceprodel quien no le ha negado su petición sino que le ha otorgado créditos que los ha sabido invertir en la compra de sus productos y ahorro para la remodelación de su hogar. Su record crediticio es de 8 créditos desde hace un año y medio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Eddy Abercio

texts.es:
Eddy S. is a young man who has demonstrated skills for carpentry work since he was a young man. His business is located in the patio of his house, with the advantage of being located in a very busy area. He is also one of few carpenters in his village, El Sauce, in the city of León.

The need this gentleman faces is that in order to continue maintaining his humble household (wife and son ) along with his elderly parents, he needs to invest in the purchase of wood and tools in better condition than those he currently uses. This will allow him to continue providing a good service to his clients. For this reason he turns to Ceprodel, to receive the loans that allow him to purchase tools and wood of excellent quality. His credit record with Ceprodel is 4 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Eddy S. es un joven que desde muy pequeño ha tenido la habilidad de trabajar en la carpintería. El negocio lo ubica en el patio de su casa teniendo la ventaja de estar ubicado en un lugar muy visitado y adema es uno de los pocos carpinteros de su pueblo El Sauce en la ciudad de Leon.

La necesidad que atraviesa este caballero es que para continuar manteniendo su humilde hogar(esposa e hijo) y a sus ancianos padres requiere invertir en la compra de la madera y de herramientas en mejor estado para continuar brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Por tal motivo es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan la compra de las herramientas y madera de excelente calidad. Su record crediticio es de 4 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of wood and tools

loans.name: Guillermo Ramón

texts.es:
Guillermo S. is an enterprising gentleman originally from the city of León, specifically the village El Sauce in León. For ten years, he has been working in his own home in a carpentry business in which he crafts all types of furniture which he later sells to his local clients. For some time he has been known for doing very detailed work of high quality. For this reason he feels very committed to improving his quality and maintaining his loyal clientele. With this commitment in mind, he turns to Ceprodel to request another of the loans that have allowed him to purchase the wood and tools he needs for his work. He has been working with Ceprodel for 4 years and feels privileged, since these loans have opened the door to new opportunities to sell his furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermo S. es un esforzado caballero originario de la ciudad de León específicamente de el pueblo El Sauce en esta ciudad .Actualmente tiene 10 años de trabajar en su hogar propio en un negocio de carpintería donde elabora todo tipo de muebles para luego venderlos a los clientes de su localidad.

Por mucho tiempo se ha caracterizado por realizar trabajos muy finos y de alta calidad es por esto que se siente muy comprometido en mejorar su calidad y mantener siempre su fiel clientela. Por este motivo acude a Ceprodel para optar por los créditos que le benefician para la compra de la madera y herramientas de trabajo. Actualmente trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy beneficiado debido a que por medio de estos créditos se le han abierto puertas de oportunidades para vender sus muebles.

loans.use: Purchase of wood for his work

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu started her business by selling a few boxes of cigarettes on a table.  A 37 year old mother of 6 children, she works hard to generate income to feed her children.  Her husband’s meagre income is insufficient to meet all the family expenses.  With her 3 previous micro loans she diversified her business within the homestead.  Yeabu is beginning to experience success and growth  and would like to continue to develop her dream by developing the small kiosk into a shop.  She requests a loan of $350.00 to begin her dream.

loans.use: To open a shop.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosalina G. is a very enterprising person. For four years she has earned her living preparing and selling delicious tortillas in her home in the city of León - in the village of El Sauce, to be exact. It's important to stress that Rosalina is a widowed mother of 2 children. She carries full responsibility for offering them an education since she fulfills the role of both father and mother in her household.

SInce she started her business preparing and selling tortillas she has been investing in the education of her children, supporting them in their needs and providing them with a decent home in which to live.

Rosalina has been receiving loans from Ceprodel for a year. The loans have been of tremendous benefit, since she has purchased her raw material (firewood and corn) with which to prepare delicious tortillas in the village of El Sauce in León.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosalina G. es una persona muy esforzada, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosas tortillas en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de León específicamente en el pueblo El Sauce. Es importante recalcar que la señora Rosalina es madre viuda y con 2 hijos de los cuales tiene la responsabilidad de brindarles educación ya que hace el papel de padre y madre en su hogar.

Desde que inició el negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas ha venido invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos apoyándolos en sus necesidades y brindándoles un techo digno donde vivir.

Desde hace un año, ha realizado prestamos en Ceprodel los cuales le han beneficiado grandemente por el hecho de que ha adquirido su materia prima (leña y maíz) para la elaboración de las deliciosas tortillas en el pueblo de El Sauce en León.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Luvy Victoria

texts.es:
Mrs. Luvy M. is a very persistent about getting ahead. She is a married mother who has always distinguished herself selling prepared foods from her home. With the small amount of savings from her food sales she decided to improve the infrastructure of her house in order to provide better service to her loyal clients.

Her business is highly frequented because she is an excellent cook and very well known in the village where she lives. Despite the good demand for her products, Mrs. M. faces the urgent need to buy the raw materials with which she prepares her food. With this need in mind, she turns to Ceprodel and requests a loan that will allow her to buy the raw materials, prepare her food products and continue supporting her family.

Currently her credit record with Ceprodel is 4 loans, all paid on time and according to her loan agreement.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Luvy M. es una mujer muy luchadora, madre casada que se ha destacado trabajando siempre en la venta de comida que realiza en su casa de habitacion. Con el poco ahorro de sus ventas decide mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para brindar una mejora atención a sus fieles clientes.

Su negocio se caracteriza por ser muy visitado debido a que ella es una excelentísima cocinera y muy reconocida en el pueblo en que habita. A pesar de esto, una necesidad que atraviesa la señora M. es la urgencia de la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos y es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel solicitando crédito que le permitan adquirir su materia prima y elaborar sus alimentos para continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar.

Actualmente su record crediticio es de 4 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma según lo estipulado.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas has been a member of the “Triunfo" bank for 13 years. She was invited to join the bank by a friend. Since joining, she has learned how to save, how to educate her children, and how to be independent. Felicitas mentioned that the associates at the community bank are united and help each other at difficult times.

Felicitas is forty years old. She is married and has two children. Felicitas started selling car parts many years ago. Little by little, by using loans and her savings in the community bank, Felicitas improved her business by adding filters and oil.

Felicitas needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy a larger variety of car parts.

A key aspect of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Felicitas plans to use her savings to improve her home and business. Her dream is to own an auto repair shop and that her children will be professionals.

loans.use: Felicitas needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy a larger variety of car parts.

loans.name: Paula Del Socorro

texts.es:
Paula V. owns a food-selling business which operates from her home in the village of El Sauce near the city of León in Nicaragua.

Señora V. has run this business for 16 years, starting with a total of 500 Nicaraguan Córdoba (about $25 USD), the result of a loan which she took out from a moneylender.

As the years have rolled by, she has struggled to improve her financial situation and for this reason she approached Ceprodel who have provided her with support, authorising credits to invest in the improvement of her business site and the purchase of primary materials.

Today, thanks to the credits provided by Ceprodel she has partially improved her business, both in terms of infrastructure and the purchase of raw ingredients for food preparation. Her credit record is 5 credits with Ceprodel.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El negocio de la Señora Paula V. es la venta de comida teniendo su negocio en su casa de habitación en el pueblo El Sauce de la ciudad de León en Nicaragua.

La Señora V. tiene 16 años de tener su negocio que inicio con un pequeño monto de C$ 500 (Quinientos córdobas netos) producto del préstamo que realizó a un prestamista.

A medida que han venido transcurriendo los años se ha esforzado por mejorar su situación financiera y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado apoyo otorgándole créditos invertidos en la mejora de su local y la compra de materia prima para los alimentos.

Hoy en día gracias a los créditos brindados por Ceprodel ha mejorado en parte su negocio tanto en infraestructura como en la compra de su materia prima para la preparación de los alimentos. Su record crediticio es de 5 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Ruth Viviana's Group

texts.en:
Ruth and Maria have been members of the “Triunfo” community bank for four months. In the community bank, they have learned values, such as saving and working together. They commented that they feel united and know they have support within the bank.

Ruth is 21 years old. She lives with her partner and is expecting her first child. Ruth has been selling clothing for eight months. She travels nine hours to the city of Lima to sell the clothing to her friends and family.

Maria is 36 years old. She is a widow and has two children, who are ages eight and eleven. Maria sells a variety of seasonal products. For example, during the festival season, she sells face paint and decorations. Now she is planning to travel to Lima to buy school supplies to prepare for the school season.

Ruth and Maria need loans of 400 and 1000 soles respectively, which they will invest in buying shirts, pants, paint, pens, pencils, and notebooks.

One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Ruth and Maria plan to use their savings to improve their business, study a specialty, and buy a house. Their dreams are to eventually finish their own studies, pay for their children’s education, and hope that their businesses will continue to grow.

loans.use: Ruth and Maria need loans of 400 and 1000 soles respectively, which they will invest in buying shirts, pants, paint, pens, pencils, and notebooks.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina G. is a very hard-working person: for the last 4 years she has dedicated herself to the making and selling of delicious tortillas from her home in the city of León, specifically the village of El Sauce. It is important to be aware that Rosalina is a widowed mother with two children, for whom she has the responsibility to provide education and must play the role of both father and mother at home.

Since she started her business making and selling tortillas she has been able to invest in the education of her children, helping them with the essentials and providing them with a worthy roof to live under.

For the last year, she has taken out loans with Ceprodel, which have helped her greatly, as she has been able to acquire raw materials (firewood and corn) for the fabrication of her delicious tortilla in the village of El Sauce in León.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosalina G. es una persona muy esforzada, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosas tortillas en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de León específicamente en el pueblo El Sauce. Es importante recalcar que la señora Rosalina es madre viuda y con 2 hijos de los cuales tiene la responsabilidad de brindarles educación ya que hace el papel de padre y madre en su hogar.

Desde que inició el negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas ha venido invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos apoyándolos en sus necesidades y brindándoles un techo digno donde vivir.

Desde hace un año, ha realizado prestamos en Ceprodel los cuales le han beneficiado grandemente por el hecho de que ha adquirido su materia prima (leña y maíz) para la elaboración de las deliciosas tortillas en el pueblo de El Sauce en León.

loans.use: Purchase firewood and corn

loans.name: Mohamed Baufelloh

texts.en: Mohamed J. is 47 years old and married with 9 children.  He lives in Dogolia village of Koinadugu, Sierra Leone.  Mohamed buys and sells cows, and also keeps some for the family milk.  With his previous loans, he purchased a cow twice a week and sold them in Freetown.  Mohamed says that the previous loan enabled him to continue to raise his family cow until maturity for production.  He is requesting $1200.00 to enable him to purchase 3 cows at once, twice a month and make a good  profit.

loans.use: To purchase and sell cattle.

loans.name: Lucas Evangelisto

texts.es:
Lucas M. in the father of three children, and together with his wife he fights to provide them with education, food and all other necessities. Lucas M. has a convenience store which since a young age he has been developing in his house in the village of Las Pilas, located in Chinandega in Nicaragua.

He started up his business during a difficult economic crisis: he tells us that it was very hard as he had no idea how he was going to provide for his children, so he decided to invest in the business.

With the experience that he has gained over time, the business has been strengthened and in this way he has been able to supply the necessities for his home. He has worked with Ceprodel for the last five years and he feels very satisfied with the authorised credits he has received as they have been provided when he most needs them in order to purchase products for his convenience store. His most pressing need is to purchase products for his hardware store.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Lucas M. es padre de tres hijos que junto con su esposa lucha por brindarles su educación, alimentación y todas las necesidades. El negocio del Lucas Mendez es padre de tres hijos que junto con su esposa lucha por brindarles su educación, alimentación y todas las necesidades. El negocio del señor M. es una pulpería que desde muy joven la ha venido desarrollando en su casa de habitación en el pueblo Las Pilas ubicado en Chinandega de Nicaragua.

El negocio lo comienza cuando atraviesa una fuerte crisis económica y nos dice que fue muy duro ya que no tenia idea de cómo iba a mantener a sus hijos por lo que decide invertir en este negocio.

Con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo, el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, y de esta manera ha podido suplir las necesidades del hogar. El trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 5 años y se siente muy satisfecho con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados cuando mas lo necesita para la compra de todos los productos para su pulpería. Su mayor necesidad es la compra de los productos de su ferretería.

loans.use: Purchase of products for Convenience Store

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Maria, Evelyn, and Victoria have been members of the community bank for less then one year. In that time, they have learned to be punctual and to save, learned how to run their business efficiently, and learned how to work together.

Maria is 45 years old. She is married and has five children. Maria makes popular local breads such as “chapla,” which is similar to pita bread. She works with two of her children and uses a rented oven. They then sell the bread from the oven.

Victoria is 45 years old. She is separated and is raising her four children. Victoria sells backpacks and other bags on the main street of Ayacucho. She has been doing this for many years.

Evelyn is 26 years old. She is separated and has two children. Evelyn also makes popular breads such as chapla. Evelyn also sells sugar, yeast, and salt to other people who make bread.

Maria, Evelyn, and Victoria need loans of 600, 600, and 1500 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying wheat, firewood, sugar, yeast, and backpacks.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earnings savings account each associate has. Maria, Evelyn, and Victoria plan to use their savings to buy a piece of land, a refrigerator, and to save for old age. Their dreams are that their children will be professionals, they will own a home, and they will be able to live comfortably.

loans.use: Maria, Evelyn, and Victoria need loans of 600, 600, and 1500 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying wheat, firewood, sugar, yeast, and backpacks.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu is married with two children.  She started selling wood a long time ago.  With previous loans from SMT, she expanded the business and is now able to purchase half a lorry of wood at the same time.  To expand her business further and make more profits, she is requesting for a loan of $350.00 to enable her to purchase one full lorry of wood at a time.  Kadiatu is 33 years old.

loans.use: To do more business on wholesale

loans.name: Alejos Antonio

texts.es:
The sale of hardware products is a very competitive business as there already exist many hardware stores which offer these products. Being conscious of this, Alejos A. devotes himself to the sale of hardware products in the village of Villanueva in Chinadega in Nicaragua.
Before having the business he used to sell lottery tickets, walking through the streets of Villanueva, however due to low income he decided to invest in the purchase of hardware products.  On having an equipped business site, he decided to invest in his business and it is for this reason he has made use of credits authorised for Ceprodel which he recounts have benefited him enormously in the purchase of new materials to sell and to maintain his immediate family.
It is important to record that since he started receiving these credits, he has been a faithful client paying back on time and in full. His dream is to expand his business and to provide his children with a better lifestyle.
Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer
 La venta de productos ferreteros es un negocio muy competitivo ya que existen muchas ferreterías que ofertan tales productos. Consiente de esta situación, el señor Alejos A. se dedica al negocio de venta de productos ferreteros en el pueblo de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega en nicaragua.
Antes de tener el negocio se dedicaba a vender loteria ambulante por las calles de Villanueva, sin embargo por motivos de bajos ingresos decide invertir en la compra de productos ferreteros. Al tener el local acondicionado decide invertir en su negocio y es por esta razón es que hace uso de los créditos otorgados por Ceprodel que según cuenta le han beneficiado grandemente en la compra de nuevos materiales de venta y para mantener su núcleo familiar.
Es importante señalar que desde que inició con estos créditos, ha sido un fiel cliente pagándolos en tiempo y forma. Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio y brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of hardware products

loans.name: Elina Sofia

texts.es:
professionalism in those who decide to take-up this activity, as the customer’s decision is based every time on who prepares the best dishes. For this reason Elina R. is an excellent cook and occupies herself selling food in the beautiful town of Villanueva in the town of Chinadega.

Six years ago she started this activity from her own house, however as the months passed and because of the need to provide for her two small children, she looked for a means to increase her sales and thus began to invest in her business.

Today, thank to the help that Ceprodel has provided through loans, she has managed to expand her business through purchasing plates, pots and pan and cutlery. Her current needs is to invest in the purchase of raw ingredients to make her dishes and to thus continue offering a good service to her faithful clientele.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La venta de comida es un negocio que necesita un alto grado de experiencia y profesionalidad para quien se dedica a esta actividad por el hecho de que la decisión del cliente se basa en todo momento en comprar a quien prepare mejor los alimentos. Por este motivo la señora Elina R. es una excelente cocinera y se dedica al negocio de venta de comida en el hermoso pueblo de Villanueva en la ciudad de Chinandega.

Desde hace 6 años inició esta actividad en su propia casa, sin embargo a medida que pasaron los meses y por la necesidad de mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos, buscó la manera de incrementar sus ventas y para ello comenzó a invertir en su negocio.

Hoy en día gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel por medio de los préstamos, ha logrado ampliar su negocio en la compra de materiales como platos, pailas y cubiertos. Su necesidad actualmente es invertir en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los productos y así seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a su fiel clientela.

loans.use: Purchase of raw ingredients for food production

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora F. is a very hard-working women, who for the past twenty years has dedicated herself to the sale of fruits in the town of Villanueva in the beautiful municipality of Chinandega in Nicaragua. She is a woman of happy and humble character. She established her building with capital obtained from her long-term savings.

She is now the mother of a young son for whom she has the duty to provide education. Her dearest wish is that her son can be educated to be a professional and won’t suffer as she considers she suffered from a very young age with heavy work.

It’s necessary to state that Maria Auxiliadora F. currently doesn’t have a permanent business site, so sells her products in Villanueva park. For this reason she approached CEPRODEL in order to become a beneficiary of credits which she will be able to invest in the purchase of stock and also in the improvement of her business area.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Auxiliadora F. es una dama muy trabajadora que desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de frutas en la ciudad de Villanueva de la bella ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Se caracteriza por ser una dama muy alegre y humilde. Su negocio lo comenzó con un capital obtenidos por medio de sus ahorros de largo tiempo.

Actualmente es madre de un hijo el cual tiene el deber de brindarle educación ya que es menor de edad. Su mayor anhelo es que su hijo se prepare para poder ser profesional y no sufrir como ella considera que sufrió desde muy joven con trabajos muy pesados.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Maria Auxiliadora F. actualmente no posee un local propio por lo que vende sus productos en el parque de Villanueva. Por esta razón es que acuda a CEPRODEL para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan invertir en la compra de los productos y además en el mejoramiento de su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase fruits

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: 32 years old, Moses is a father of two children and a wife.  Moses started his business as a trader in Makeni town.  Life was not easy with his irregular income.  With previous, small loans, he was able to rent a small shop in Makeni town in Sierra Leone.  He is requesting for a $1,050 loan to increase his stock.

loans.use: To expand his business further with additional capital.

loans.name: Neptalia

texts.es:
Neptalia E. for 20 years has worked in the business world selling medicine in her own pharmacy in the town of Villanueva near the city of Chinandega in Nicaragua. She has made herself known for being a hardworking person because every day she takes care of her store.

She is a married and a mother of two minor children. She and her husband work hard to pay for their childrens’ schooling and to give them a better life style.

To increase her earnings and to provide for her immediate family, Neptalia is asking for help from Ceprodel who has given her loans to purchase merchandise for her business. It’s important to emphasise that since Villanueva is such a small town, she is the only person who sells these medicines and that is why she really needs to aquire these products.

Translated from Spanish by Nikki of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Neptalia E. desde hace 20 años se dedica al negocio de venta de medicamentos teniendo su propia farmacia en el pueblo de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy esforzada y trabajadora debido a que todos los días atiende en su puesto de venta.

Es madre casada y con dos hijos a su cargo el cual junto con su esposo lucha para mantener sus estudios y brindarles un mejor estilo de vida a sus pequeños.

Para incrementar sus ingresos y así mantener su núcleo familiar, la señora Neptalia busca apoyo en Ceprodel quien le ha brindado créditos para surtir su negocio y ser una gran comerciante. Es necesario destacar que por ser Villanueva un pequeño pueblo ella es la única persona que vende estos medicamentos por lo que urge la adquisición de tales productos.

loans.use: Purchase medicines

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en: Mr. Abdulai is 40 years old and married to 2 wives and has 5 children.  He worked as a mechanic specializing in both petrol and diesel engines but the income could not meet family expenses.  From his savings and group loans from SMT, he started selling spare parts in the garage.  With his first individual loan from SMT, Abdulai expanded the business and established a shop in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Abdulai has no problem at the moment in meeting his family expenses.   He plans to open another small shop in a different location and is requesting a $1,200 loan.

loans.use: To open a second location for his business.

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
Rosa N. is a young, habitant of the community of Villanueva located in the city of Chinandega, Nicaragua. She works for herself in her business selling of stationary products. She has been doing this for the last 5 years and she operates her business out of her house. It is important to mention that the income that she generates through her business allows her to provide for her family and to support her elderly parents, who really need her help.

She is in need of more products for her stationary store and because of this she has come to Ceprodel for a loan. With the loan she will be able to invest more money in her business, and improve the way she and her beloved parents live.

She presently has a history of 4 loans through Ceprodel. Each loan has been paid back on time and in full.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Rosa N. es una joven habitante del pueblo Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de librería desde hace 5 años en su casa de habitación. Es necesario señalar que con su actividad logra suplir las necesidades de su hogar y mantener a sus ancianos padres que tanto necesitan de su apoyo.

Su necesidad actualmente es la compra de los productos de librería y para ello acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan invertir en el negocio y de esta manera mejorar su nivel de vida y el de sus queridos padres.

Actualmente su record crediticio es de 4 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo estipulado.

loans.use: Buy products for her stationary store

loans.name: Momodu

texts.en: Momodu owns a mini bus for public transport.  He started with one vehicle and saved some of the profit he made.  He then approached SMT who provided him a loan.  With the loan and his savings, he purchased a second used vehicle for the same purpose.  He made good money and has rehabilitated the house inherited from his father.  The first vehicle is now old, so he plans to buy another to replace it and is requesting $1,200 to add on the savings for this purpose.  Momodu is married to two wives and is taking care of 32 family and extended family members.

loans.use: To buy a  new mini bus to replace his aging one that he runs now.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal M. owns and operates a market in the small northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is 33 years old and is married with one child. Kamal has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit that helped him develop the business that he has been working with for the last ten years. Kamal is currently seeking additional funding so that he can further develop his business.

loans.use: To further develop his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa T. owns a mini bus for public transport.  He worked as a driver and after saving some money, Issa took loans from SMT and purchased a used vehicle.  Issa plans to buy the second vehicle.  His business provides transport especially to female traders who travel to different village markets to sell or buy business items.   He is therefore requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To buy a second vehicle so that he can meet the demand of the local women to get to the various markets each week.

loans.name: Elza

texts.en: Elza E. and her husband (her husband is pictured) own and operate a mechanics shop in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Elza and her husband have two children, who also occasionally help with the day-to-day activities of the business. They have been operating the shop for the last 12 years and they are currently seeking funding so that they can continue to develop their business.

loans.use: To further develop their business

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan H. owns and operates a market in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is 31 years old and is married with one child. He has been working with his business for the last 10 years. Ruslan is currently seeking funding so that he can invest in and develop his business.

loans.use: To further develop his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en: Sadiq B. (whose son is pictured) owns and operates a household goods store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is 57 years old and is married with one son. Sadiq has been working in this business for the last 12 years and is currently seeking $1,300 of funding ($1,200 to come from Kiva and the remaining $100 to come from Norwegian Microcredit) so that he can invest in and develop his business.

loans.use: To further develop his business

loans.name: Melahet

texts.en: Melahet M. and her husband own and operate a market in the small northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. She and her husband have been working in this store for the last 16 years and have four children, some of whom also work at the store. Melahet and her husband are currently seeking funding so that they can increase the quantity and variety of their inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of inventory

loans.name: Rehman

texts.en: Rehman M. is a taxi driver in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is 41 years old and is married with two children. Rehman has been working as a taxi driver for the last 10 years and has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently seeking additional funding so that he can make repairs and improvements to his taxi cab.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements to his taxi cab

loans.name: Memmed

texts.en: Memmed R. owns and operates a furniture store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Memmed is 57 years old and is married with three children. He has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently seeking additional funding so that he can make improvements to his store.

loans.use: To make improvements to his furniture store

loans.name: Miringilab

texts.en: Miringilab A. is a fresh fish vendor in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is married with one child and has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently seeking additional funding so that he can invest in and grow his business operation.

loans.use: To invest in the growth of his business

loans.name: Marylu

texts.es:
I run a general store from my home, and thank God I have been successful. Now I would like to invest in the purchase of merchandise as well as make some improvements to my shop, giving it a better appearance. I have faith that I will be even more successful, but I know that I have to work hard in order to obtain that success. Thus, I am willing to do what it takes because this business is my sole source of income. I am requesting $1,200.00 USD to invest in my business. 
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
“En mi vivienda tengo un negocio de abarrotes y gracias a Dios me ha ido bien, ahora me gustaría invertir en la compra de mercancía y hacerle algunos arreglos para darle una mejor imagen tengo mucha fe en que me va a ir mucho mejor, se que tengo que trabajar mucho para lograrlo pero estoy dispuesta a hacerlo ya que este negocio es el único ingreso que tengo” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio

loans.use: Invest in my business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 26, 2008)
Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Melahet

texts.en: Melahet O. owns and operates a small clothing store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. She is 50 years old and is a single businesswoman who has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. Melahet has been working with this business for the last 10 years and is currently seeking $1,400 of funding ($1,200 to come from Kiva, and the remaining $200 to come from Norwegian Microcredit) so that she can purchase inventory for the spring and summer seasons.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory for the spring and summer

loans.name: Guldeste

texts.en: Guldeste E. and her husband own and operate a clothing store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. She is 45 years old and has three children. Guldeste is currently looking for funding so that she and her husband can purchase the inventory they will need for the spring and summer seasons that are rapidly approaching.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory for the spring and summer months

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es:
I feel that my house is very unprotected, so I would like to give my family more security by constructing a protective wall in front of my home. I work as a delivery person, which means I am not home all day, so this wall will make me feel more at ease. I am requesting $800.00 USD to build a protective wall in front of my home.
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
“Siento muy desprotegida mi vivienda así es que me gustaría darle más protección y seguridad a mi familia con la construcción de una barda al frente, trabajo como repartidor y no estoy en casa en todo el día de esa manera estaré más tranquilo”. Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para construir una barda en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of a protective wall in front of my home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in raw materials for his operation

loans.name: Daniela Isamary

texts.es:
I run a small business from my home, and would like to invest in the purchase of merchandise because I lack a lot of items. I have saved some money, with which I bought a glass display case, but now I need to invest a little more in order to boost my earnings. I am requesting a loan of $700.00 USD in order to invest it in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un negocio pequeño en mi vivienda y me gustaría invertir en la compra de mercancía ya que me hacen falta muchas cosas, he juntado algo de dinero y con eso compre una vitrina, pero ahora necesito invertirle un poco para así obtener más ganancias”. Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in my business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Candelaria's Group

texts.en:
Candelaria and Julia are members of the “Kantuta” community bank. Candelaria joined two years ago, while Julia joined four months ago. In that time, they have learned responsibility, how to improve their businesses, and the importance of saving.

Candelaria is 47 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of six and twenty-three. Candelaria has two businesses. She has been selling veterinary and agricultural products for several years. One year ago, she started selling clothing in order to have a more steady income during non-planting seasons. Previously, she owned a small store but her husband took it, and she has since left him. She hopes to open a new store in the future.

Julia is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. She travels for two to three hours to buy products at regional markets, and then she sells them in the city of Ayacucho. Julia sells food staples, such as flour, sugar, and oil. She also sells soft drinks and coca leaves, which are used for tea.

Candelaria and Juilia need loans of 600 and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to but clothing, fertilizer, seeds, animal feed, coca, wheat, and candies.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Candelaria and Julia plan to use their savings to increase the capital available to their businesses, open a store, and improve their homes. Their dreams are to eventually own a home and have large businesses, and hope that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: Candelaria and Juilia need loans of 600 and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy clothing, fertilizer, seeds, animal feed, coca, wheat, and candies.

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.es:
Ana V. is a single mother who works with zeal to be able to put food on the table in her humble home. She lives in El Sauce. Her only son is in school. She has been working for the past 10 years as a teacher of young students at a local primary school.

She urgently needs to invest on the infrastructure of her house. She needs money for the materials and construction and the labor before the rainy season comes, because whenever it comes around her house ends up flooded.

For this reason, Mrs. V. has come to Ceprodel for help. Ceprodel has already begun to help her with loans that have allowed her to purchase materials for construction and have allowed her to give her son an improved home and quality of life. Now she needs a little more in order to complete her home improvement project.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Ana V. es madre soltera que con gran ahínco se esfuerza para llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación en El Sauce. Su único hijo se encuentra en edad escolar y es por eso que la señora V. desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica a la profesión de docencia dando clase a niños de primaria en un colegio de su localidad.

Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa la señora Ana V. es la urgencia de invertir en la infraestructura de su casa debido a que ha iniciado la remodelación de su humilde hogar y para esto necesita adquirir los materiales de construcción y el pago de la mano de obra antes de que el invierno le visite y se produzcan muchas inundaciones en su hogar a causa de la lluvia.

Por esta razón es que la señora V. acude a Ceprodel quien le ha iniciado a apoyar con créditos que le han beneficiado tanto que ha adquirido parte de los materiales para la construcción y así brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su hijo que tanto necesita del apoyo de su querida madre.

loans.use: Improve her home to stop flooding

loans.name: Arlen María

texts.es:
Arlen Gamez is a woman who for a long time has suffered because of the poor condition that her home is in. She is the mother of two school-aged children. They are the reason why she works so hard every day. She is a teacher’s aide at a primary school and she wants to give her children the best life possible.

Presently she has started making much needed improvements and repairs to her home. Her home’s floor and roof were in terrible conditions. Also, the walls were deteriorating and for that reason Arlen is looking for a way to improve the conditions of her home. Ceprodel has provided Arlen with loans to be able to buy materials to improve the conditions of her home. Her greatest need now is to continue investing in the improvement of her home so that she will be able to raise the level of living for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Arlen Gamez es una dama que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado una problemática como lo es el mal estado de la infraestructura de su casa. Es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar y según comenta ellos son el motivo por el cual se esfuerza día a día en su trabajo de docencia de educación primaria para brindarles buenas condiciones de vida a sus pequeños.

Actualmente ha iniciado poco a poco a remodelar su hogar ya que tenía problemáticas por lo que no contaba con piso y el techo estaba en malas condiciones. Además las paredes estaban deterioradas y por tal motivo es que busca la manera de mejorar esta situación y lo ha realizado por medio de los créditos brindados en Ceprodel alcanzando a comprar parte de los materiales de construcción para la remodelación de su hogar. Actualmente su mayor necesidad es continuar invirtiendo en su hogar para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de los suyos.

loans.use: Improve her home

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.es:
Bismark Ramirez is a young father with a son who he is responsible for providing for. He works as a barber in the neighborhood of El Sauce, in the city of Leon en Nicaragua. His is known as the barber and is characterized as a good barber. He has various clients that daily visit him in his small place, which is located inside of his home.

For a long time now he’s been working hard to better his economic condition and that of his immediate family. For this reason he is now is investing in the infrastructure of his small place inside of his house for his barber shop and he is also investing in purchasing products like scissors, baby powder, combs, brushes, gel and etc. His greatest dream is to provide his son with a university education that will make him a professional. He plans to finance his son’s education with the earnings from his business because he believes that his business will expand in a short amount of time.

To make his dreams come true, the young Bismarck has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan that will improve his business and will make him be the best barber in his neighborhood. He presently has a history of four loans through Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Bismark Ramirez es un joven padre con un hijo a su responsabilidad y se dedica al negocio de barbería en el municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de Leon en Nicaragua. Es conocido comúnmente como el barberito y se caracteriza por ser un buen barbero ya que posee varios clientes que a diario le vistan en su pequeño local donde se ubica que es en su casa de habitación.

Por mucho tiempo atrás ha venido esforzándose grandemente para mejorar su condición económica y la de su núcleo familiar es por tal motivo que ha iniciado a invertir en la infraestructura de su local y en la adquisición de sus productos tales como tijeras, talco, peines, cepillos, gelatinas, etc. Su mayor anhelo es preparar profesionalmente a su hijo y según comenta esto lo realizara por medio de su negocio que cree que se engrandecerá en no muy largo tiempo.

Para ver realizado todos estos sueños el joven Bismarck ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le beneficien en el mejoramiento de su negocio y lograr así ser el mejor barbero de su localidad. Actualmente tiene un record de 4 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase products for the barber shop lie scissors, baby powder, combs, brushes, gel, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.en:
Maria Elisa is 47 years old. She is married and has two teenage children. Her eldest is studying architecture at the university and her youngest is still in high school. Maria is a member of the “Kantuta” community bank . She has belonged for eight months. In that time, she has learned the importance of saving.

Maria owns a dessert shop and café. Previously, she owned a restaurant, but changed two years ago because she enjoys desserts. She now makes all of the products herself, unlike her restaurant, where she employed a cook.

Maria needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy a semi-industrial mixer, as well as other supplies, such as flour, sugar, and butter.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Maria plans to use her savings to further improve her business and to pay for her daughter’s education. Her dream is that her café will succeed and her daughters will be professionals.

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy a semi-industrial mixer, as well as other supplies, such as flour, sugar, and butter.

loans.name: Damaris Carolina

texts.es:
In the city of León in the town of El Sauce, Señora Damaris L. has for ten years been dedicated to the business of selling clothes and footwear from her home.

She is a married mother with a young son. She makes a grand effort to meet all his needs. A problem that Señora Damaris has faced is that due to her difficult economical situation, she has had moments in which she hasn't met with sufficient capital to acquire the clothing and footwear products to sell.

For this reason she requests a loan from Ceprodel to allow a boost in her business and merchandise. This will enable her to continue maintaining her home. So far she has received three successful loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

En la ciudad de León específicamente en el municipio de El Sauce, la señora Damaris L. desde hace diez años se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa y calzados teniendo su negocio en sus propio hogar de habitación.

Es madre casada y con un pequeño hijo a su cargo, por tal motivo se esfuerza grandemente para suplir todas las necesidades de su hijo. Una problemática que ha atravesado la señora Damaris es que a pesar de su difícil situación económica ha habido momentos en los cuales no ha contado con el capital suficiente para adquirir de sus proveedores la ropa y el calzado para comercializarlos.

Por este motivo acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan surtir su negocio de mercadería y de esta manera continuar con el mantenimientos de su hogar de habitación. Actualmente su record es de tres créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Buy merchandise like clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Deyanira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Deyanira S. is a woman who owns her own commercial space. She runs a small general store out of this space, which is located in the city of León, specifically in the community of El Sauce.

For the past 15 yeas she has worked in the general store. She opens the doors very early every morning so that she will be able to serve her customers and generate more income. Her income goes to providing for her family and paying for her son’s schooling.

Deyanira is in need of investing in the infrastructure of her business because there are other general stores close to hers and they sell the same types of products, but their stores look better than hers does. The situation is problematic because customers prefer to shop at the stores that look better. Despite this problem, she does not lose hope and dreams of making herself a great businessperson. For that reason, she has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan that will allow her to buy merchandise for products and invest in buying construction materials that will improve the conditions of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Deyanira S. es una dama poseedora de un local propio donde atiende su negocio de pulpería en la ciudad de León específicamente en el pueblo El Sauce.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica al negocio de la pulpería y es por esta razón que desde muy temprano todos los días abre sus puertas para atender al publico en general y así generar ganancias para el mantenimiento de su hogar y el estudio de su hijo.

Una necesidad que atraviesa la señora Deyanira es que necesita invertir en la infraestructura de su negocio por lo que hay otras pulperías cerca de su local el cual venden los mismos productos pero el local está en mejores condiciones; hasta cierto punto esta es una situación problemita para la señora Rosales porque los clientes seleccionan los lugares que en mejores condiciones se encuentran. A pesar de este situación, ella no pierde las esperanzas de convertirse en una gran comerciante y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha proveído de créditos que los ha utilizado para adquirir sus productos y de igual forma para invertir en la compra de materiales para mejorar las condiciones de su localidad.

loans.use: Invest in products and store infrastructure.

loans.name: Reyna's Group

texts.en:
Alberta and Reyna have been members of the “Aleli” community bank for seven years. In that time, they have learned the importance of saving, punctuality, and responsibility.

Alberta is 42 years old. She lives with her partner and two young children. Alberta has a business selling small items, such as candies, stickers, and cigarettes, from a cart at various locations in the city. Alberta has been running this business for ten years.

Reyna is 45 years old. She also lives with her partner and two children. Reyna raises animals, such as cows and sheep, and sells them from her house. She has had this business for five years.

Alberta and Reyna each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in candies, gum, cookies, juice, animal feed, and baby animals.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Alberta and Reyna plan to use their savings to pay for unexpected expenses, to make their homes nicer, and to buy more land. Their dream is to continue moving forward in life.

loans.use: Alberta and Reyna each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in candies, gum, cookies, juice, animal feed, and baby animals.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
For the past 10 years Esperanza Valásquez has worked selling vegetables in the city of León, specifically in the district of El Sauce. She started her business with an investment of C$500 (five-hundred Córdobas Netos) and little by little, as the years passed, the economic situation of her business has improved.

She has the responsibility to provide for her three small children (a boy and two girls) who need her. For this reason Esperanza works hard everyday to provide her children with an education, food, clothing and a decent place to live.

This is why Esperanza has come to Ceprodel to ask for a microloan which will allow her to improve her economic situation. With the loan she will be able to purchase products in bulk and then sell them for a profit.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 10 años la señora Esperanza V. se dedica a la venta de verduras en la ciudad de León específicamente en el Municipio de El Sauce. Su negocio lo comenzó con una inversión de C$ 500 (Quinientos córdobas netos) por lo que a través de los años ha venido mejorando poco a poco la situación económica de su negocio.

Actualmente tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres pequeños hijos (Un niño y dos niñas) que necesitan del calor de su madre y para ello se esfuerza grandemente brindándoles educación, alimentación y un digno techo donde habitar.

Por esta razón es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos directos que le permitan mejorar su situación económica en la adquisición de mayores cantidades de productos para su respectiva comercialización.

loans.use: Purchase products in bulk

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is forty-two years old. She is a widow and has four children between the ages of twelve and twenty-four. Albina is a member of the “Aleli” community bank . She has belonged to that bank for seven years. In that time, she has learned the importance of punctuality and responsibility.

Albina sells candies and small trinkets, as well as firewood, from a cart that she moves all around the city. She has been running this business for the past six years.

Albina needs a loan of 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more products such as candy, gum, stickers, and juice.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Albina plans to use her savings to build a house. Her dream is to eventually own a home and be able to give her children a better life.

loans.use: Albina needs a loan of 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more products, such as candy, gum, stickers, and juice.

loans.name: Dionisia's Group

texts.en:
Nancy and Dionisia have been members of the “Aleli” community bank for four months. In that time, they have learned the importance of responsibility, punctuality, and friendship.

Nancy is 32 years old. She lives with her partner and three-year-old daughter. Nancy works with her husband driving a motorcycle taxi, doing construction work, and making furniture. They have been working in construction for five years and driving a taxi for one year.

Dionisia is 32 years old. She lives with her partner and has five children between the ages of two and ten. Like Nancy, Dionisia and her partner do construction work and make furniture. They have been working together for four years.

Nancy and Dionisia each need loans of 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy replacement parts for the taxi, as well as wood, nails, varnish, and paint.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Nancy and Dionisia plan to use their savings to buy a computer and to make more capital available to their businesses. Their dreams are to eventually own a home and a car, and to have a happy family.

loans.use: Nancy and Dionisia each need loans of 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy replacement parts for the taxi, as well as wood, nails, varnish, and paint.

loans.name: Giovanna Del Carmen's Group

texts.en:
Giovanna, Erika, and Claudia are have all been members of the “Nueva Vida” community bank for between one and two years. One of the things they like the most about the community bank are the interest-earning savings accounts that each associate has. Since joining the bank, they have learned the importance of saving.

Giovanna is 29 years old. She is a single mom and has one three-year-old child. Giovanna takes clothing orders from people she knows and then travels ten hours to Lima once per month to buy the clothing. She has had this business for three years.

Erika is 21 years old. She is studying computer science at the local university. Erika sells cosmetics from a catalogue to help pay for school.

Claudia is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. Claudia has been selling vegetables from the market in Ayacucho for five years.

Giovanna, Erika, and Claudia need loans of 600, 1000, and 600 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their businesses by buyings things such as shirts, pants, squash, and carrots.

One of the most important things about the community bank are the interest-earning savings accounts that each associate has. Giovanna, Erika, and Claudia plan to use their savings to make more capital available for their businesses, and to pay for their own education and the education of their children. Their dreams are to continue working, be stable economically, and to hope that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Giovanna, Erika, and Claudia need loans of 600, 1000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their businesses by buyings things such as shirts, pants, squash, and carrots.

loans.name: Hilaria Ayda's Group

texts.en:
Hilaria, Martha, and Esther are members of the “Nueva Vida” community bank . Hilaria has been a member for two years, while Martha and Esther joined less than one year ago. In that time, they have learned the importance of saving, responsibility, and how to treat their children.

Hilaria is 35 years old. She is married and has four children. Hilaria has owned a grocery store for several years.

Martha is 39 years old. She is a single mother and has one three-year-old daughter. Martha is has a degree in electrical engineering, but is unable to find work in that field. Currently, she has a business selling natural health products.

Esther is twenty. She is currently preparing for entrance exams to the local university. There, she plans to study accounting. Esther helps her sister, who owns a clothing store, and will invest the money from the loan her sister’s business.

Hilaria, Martha, and Esther need loans of 450, 1000, and 300 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy a piece of land, a new line of vitamins, and a variety of clothing items.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Hilaria, Martha, and Esther plan to use their savings combines with their loan to buy land, buy a car, and to pay for school. Their dreams are to see their children become professionals, to start an electric engineering firm, and become a professional.

loans.use: Hilaria, Martha, and Esther need loans of 450, 1000, and 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy a piece of land, a new line of vitamins, and a variety of clothing items.

loans.name: Lucia's Group

texts.en:
Lucia and Gabriela have been part of the “Gracias Morenita” community bank for a little over one year. In that time, they have learned to manage their business efficiently, to save, and to be responsible. They feel that the community bank has given them support they need and helped them to progress rather than remain stagnant.

Lucia is 48 years old. She is married and has six children. Lucia has a piece of land outside of the city where she grows a variety of grains. She also makes cheese and cuts firewood. She sells all of these things at the market in Ayacucho.

Gabriela owns a small store with her sister, who is also a member of the community bank. They sell a variety of food staples such as flour, sugar, beans, and cheese.

Lucia and Gabriela need loans of 600 and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy seeds, milk, wood, flour, noodles, and bread.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank are the interest-earning savings accounts that each associate has. Lucia and Gabriela plan to use their savings to build a house, open a day care, and pay for their children’s educations. Their dreams are to study nursing, to be secure economically, and to hope that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: Lucia and Gabriela need loans of 600 and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy seeds, milk, wood, flour, noodles, and bread.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita and Elias, her husband, have their own family business making bricks. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she has been able to make it successful. Due to the high demand, they decided to hire 2 workers. They are very happy with how the business is moving along. Margarita's dream is to build her own house and to give her son, Daniel who's her pride and joy, a good life. She's requesting a loan in order to purchase basic materials to make more bricks, and to hopefully make more profit. With this profit, she would like to purchase a piece of land where they can build their house. "Margarita awaits for your answer to make her dream come true."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita, desde que formó su familia junto a Elías, decidió dedicarse con mucha constancia al negocio familiar; que consta en la producción de ladrillos. Gracias a su empeño y compromiso viene sacando adelante su fábrica y al observar que tenían una gran cantidades de solicitudes y no podían abastecer a todos sus clientes decidieron contratar a dos trabajadores para cumplir satisfactoriamente con las demandas de sus clientes. En estos momentos esta laboriosa pareja se siente muy satisfecha por los resultados que está obteniendo poco a poco con su incansable labor. El deseo que tiene doña margarita es ofrecerle un techo propio y seguro a su querido hijo, Daniel, quien es su mayor alegría y orgullo. En esta oportunidad requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de insumos para su ladrillera y con las ganancias que obtenga adquirir un terrenito para construir su casita. “Margarita espera tu valioso aporte para concretar sus planes”.

loans.use: To purchase more basic material to make more bricks

loans.name: Felícitas

texts.es:
Doña Felícitas comes from a very hard-working family. Since she was a little girl, she would help her parents in the making or construction of bricks. Thanks to her acquired knowledge over the years, she has been able to manage a very successful brick making business which she inherited from her parents.

With this job, she was able to support and to pay for her children's education. She took care of her 2 beloved children all by herself, after separating from her husband. Today, even though she's a little bit older, she still has the same strength, eargerness and will-power to succeed. This is why she still works non-stop making all types of bricks. Felicitas dream is to expand her business even more.

She's requesting for your assistance. She commits in repaying this loan within 6 months and she promises to pay you on time. "Felicitas awaits for your promising answer."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Felícitas, proviene de una familia muy trabajadora y emprendedora, desde que tuvo uso de razón siempre apoyó a sus padres en su noble labor de ladrilleros, gracias a los conocimientos y a la experiencia que adquirió durante muchos años ha logrado sacar adelante la fábrica que heredó de sus padres.Con este noble oficio logró educar y brindarles bienestar a sus queridos hijos, por quienes se esforzó y veló constantemente desde que decidió separarse de su esposo y hacerse cargo de sus dos queridos retoños.Actualmente, pese a su avanzada edad sigue conservando la misma fuerza, voluntad, y ganas de superación, es por eso que sigue trabajando incansablemente elaborando una inmensa variedad de ladrillos.El deseo que tiene Felícitas es incrementar aún más su negocio, con este fin recorre en búsqueda de tu apoyo y hace la solicitud de un préstamo que se compromete a retornarlo en un lapso de seis meses y además promete ser puntual en el pago.“Felicitas, espera tu respuesta alentadora”

loans.use: To purchase more basic material to make bricks

loans.name: Bartola's Group

texts.en:
Bartola and Marlene are members of the “Nueva Vida” community bank. In their bank, they have learned to be responsible and punctual, and learned how to run their business more efficiently. They mentioned that they enjoy celebrating birthdays with all of the other associates and the life lessons taught by the bank organizers.

Bartola is 70 years old. She is a widow and has five children, of whom only one still lives with her. Bartola sells candies near the high school and also sells fruits from her home.

Marlene is 29 years old. She lives with her partner and three children. She used to sell fruit, but she was forced to quit due to sickness. Since then, she has opened a tailor shop.

Barlota and Marlene need loans of 600 and 1250 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy cookies, candies, gum, and to buy a new sewing machine.

One of the key aspects of the community bank are the interest-earning savings accounts that each associate has. Barlota and Marlene plan to use their savings to improve their business and to pay for their children’s education and for medical needs. Their dreams are that their businesses will continue to grow and develop, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Barlota and Marlene need loans of 600 and 1250 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy cookies, candies, gum, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Alicia is a happy mother who's 27 years old. She has been buying and selling Andean products (i.e. potato & chuño which is a freeze dried potato) for about 5 years. She goes and sells these products from door to door. She has been able to help her husband pay for all the family expenses. Above all, they would like to finish building their house. Even though, there's been a lot of financial difficulties, they are bound to finish it with a lot of effort. Alicia's biggest wish is to provide a roof for her little son, Luis, who is 4 years old. A house where he can play freely, and due to this she's working very hard. To make her dream come true, Doña Alicia is thinking about increasing her merchandise and therefore increasing her profit. With this in mind, reach to your heart and help Doña Alicia make her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Alicia, es una madre muy alegre de 27 años de edad, desde hace cinco años viene dedicándose a la compra y venta de productos andinos (papa y chuño) en forma ambulatoria, negocio con el que apoya a su esposo a cubrir los gastos de su familia, y sobre todo para terminar el refaccionamiento de su casita que con mucho esfuerzo y a pesar de las limitaciones económicas fueron construyendo.El deseo más grande de Alicia es brindarle un techo propio y seguro a su pequeño niño, Luis de cuatro años, para que pueda jugar libremente. Con este fin sigue trabajando persistentemente en su oficio.Para concretar su anhelo doña Alicia tiene pensado aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería, con este propósito en mente recurre a tu buen corazón y hace la petición de un préstamo.Vuestro desinteresado apoyo permitirá concretar los planes de Doña Alicia.

loans.use: To increase merchandise and variety of Andean products

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Señora Antonia, is very popular and well-liked at the mercado located in San Jose, Juliaca. This is where she sells from her mobile cart delicious 'potaje' which is like a stew. This hard-working and loving mother has been doing this for the past 5 years. Thanks to her friendliness and charisma, she has been able to acquire a lot of clients. She gets the help of her daughter. Her husband works in construction. They all try to give their best in order to have a good quality of life, security and above all peace for the whole family. Señora Antonia has expanded her business at the request of her clients. In order to do this, she would like to purchase chairs, plates, kitchen utensils and whatever she needs to make her clients happy. "Your generosity can help this hard-working mother reach her goal."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Antonia, es muy popular y querida en el mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde vende sus deliciosos y muy consumidos potajes al paso, en su pequeño triciclo. Esta laboriosa y amorosa madre se dedica a este oficio hace más de cinco años, gracias a su amabilidad y a su carisma ha ido obteniendo muchos clientes.Mientras ella vende diariamente sus riquísimos guisos con apoyo de su querida hija, su esposo se desenvuelve como maestro de obras. De este modo juntos tratan de dar lo mejor de sí para buscar bienestar, seguridad y sobre todo tranquilidad para su familia.La señora Antonia al observar la gran demanda de sus clientes decidió ampliar su negocio; para iniciar este proyecto tiene pensado comprar sillas, platos y utensilios de cocina con el fin de brindarles mayor comodidad a sus clientes. “Tu generosidad puede permitir que esta trabajadora madre logre su propósito”.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, plates and kitchen utensils to provide bettter customer service

loans.name: Yovana

texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the community bank named “Imasumac,” which means "how beautiful" in Quechua. She has been a member for two years. In the community bank, she has learned to save and to be responsible. Yovana commented that she likes the companionship in the bank and that she looks forward to meetings each week.

Yovana is 27 years old. She has owned a café on the central street of Ayacucho for one year. In addition, together with her husband, Yovana sells motorcycles, and they are hoping to open a second store soon.

Yovana needs a loan of 2500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy auto replacement parts.

One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Yovana plans to use her savings to buy a piece of land. Her dream is to eventually open a several cafes, begin selling motorcycles in other towns, and own a nice home.

loans.use: Yovana needs a loan of 2500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy auto replacement parts.

loans.name: Cledes

texts.es:
In one of the furtherst barrio in the city of Juliaca, lives Señora Cledes and her family. This loving mother, along with her children and husband, live in a small rental house. They wish to own a house and with this in mind they work hard and harmoniously making beautiful and unique garments. Cledes and her loving husband, Andres, started in this artistic industry about 6 years ago. They began by only knitting/sewing hand gloves, scarves and hats from Alpaca wool in small quantities. Now, with a little bit more experience and agility, they are able to make daily about 150 pullovers or sweaters and vests. They sell them at whole prices at the local market in her native city of San Jose and in the city of Desaguadero. The demand is very high due to the good quality and great workmanship. Their only problem is that they don't have enough basic material to satisfy the high demand. Cledes, Andres and her family are requesting your help so that they are able to obtain a loan to purchase more basic material.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

En uno de los barrios más lejanos de la ciudad de Juliaca encontramos a la familia de doña Cledes. Ésta amorosa madre junto a sus hijos y esposo viven en una pequeña casa alquilada, con el anhelo de tener pronto su propio domicilio, con este deseo todos juntos trabajan muy contentos y empeñosos confeccionando hermosas y distintivas prendas de vestir.Cledes y su amoroso esposo Andrés se iniciaron en este bello arte hace seis años, en un principio sólo tejían guantes, chalinas y chullos y en pocas cantidades. Ahora con mucho más experiencia y agilidad logran realizar alrededor de 150 chompas y chalecos diarios para venderlos al por mayor en el mercado San José de su ciudad natal y en la ciudad de Desaguadero.El público al ver que sus chompas están muy bien confeccionadas y con un buen material han duplicado sus pedidos, sin embargo esta familia tiene un problema no cuenta con suficiente materia prima para cumplir con las solicitudes. Cledes, Andrés y su familia acuden en búsqueda de tu ayuda para acopiar el dinero que requieren para la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima.

loans.use: To purchase more basic material at wholesale

loans.name: Marcusa

texts.es:
Señora Marcusa, together with her 5 young children, suffered a lot of physical abuse at the hands of her husband and father of her children. Fortunately, things have changed for the best since she decided to separate from her husband to gain back tranquility in her life. Since then, she has dedicated herself to her farm work and to her livestock. She harvests the land mainly to feed her family, and she takes care of her livestock for the main purpose to sell them at a profit. This hard-working single mother gets a lot of support from her eldest, who has decided to work in the mine to help her mother and his younger siblings. Marcusa wishes to obtain a loan to purchase a yearling calf. Your good heart will make Señora Marcusa's dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marcusa, junto a sus cinco menores hijos sufrieron durante muchos años constantes maltratos físicos de parte de su esposo y padre, afortunadamente las cosas han cambiado y mejorado gracias a que ella decidió separarse y recobrar su tranquilidad. Desde entonces se dedica con mucha más perseverancia a sus labores agrícolas y ganaderas.Las cosechas que realiza doña Marcusa muy hábilmente son para el autoconsumo de su familia, mientras que con la producción de ganado y venta de sus ovejitas ha ido mejorando su condición de vida.Esta luchadora madre recibe el apoyo de su amoroso hijo mayor, quien a decidido trabajar en la mina para ayudar a su madre y hermanos a salir adelante.El deseo de Marcusa es obtener un préstamo de dinero que tiene pensado invertir en la compra de una becerrita. Tu buen corazón permitirá cumplir los deseos de doña Marcusa.

loans.use: To purchase a yearling calf

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her children. She is dedicated to raising lambs and hamsters. While she is exerting herself in this, her husband, Francisco, leaves very early in the morning and travels great distances to proviD. veterinary services to peasants in need of care for their animals. The hope of these responsible parents of two small children is to purchase an artificial inseminator for animals. With this instrument and Francisco's knowledge they would be able to help improve the breeding of their clients’ animals. To reach this goal they are requesting a loan, which they plan to repay in six months. Lucía and Francisco are asking for your support in helping them fulfill their dreams soon.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Lucía, es una madre muy responsable, amorosa y preocupada por el bienestar y seguridad D. sus hijos, se dedica a la crianza D. corderos y cuyes, y mientras se esfuerza en el desempeño D. este oficio su esposo, Francisco, desD. muy temprano sale D. su hogar y recorre largos tramos para brindar sus servicios D. veterinario a todos aquellos pobladores que requieren D. su ayuda para la atención y mejoramiento D. sus animalitos.El deseo D. estos responsables padres D. dos pequeños niños es comprar un equipo D. inseminación artificial para animales, con este instrumento y los conocimientos D. don Francisco podrán ayudar a mejorar la raza D. los animales D. sus vecinos.Para concretar sus anhelos requieren obtener un préstamo que se comprometen a retornarlo en un lapso D. seis meses. Doña Lucía y Don Francisco solicitan tu colaboración para concretar pronto sus planes.
