loans.use: Purchase an artificial inseminator to improve the breeding of their clients' animals. / Compra de una herramienta de inseminación artificial para mejorar la raza de los animales de sus clientes.

loans.name: Ana Maria's Group

texts.en:
Ana Maria, Maria Jesús, and Julia are members of the community bank named “Imasumac,” which means "how beautiful" in Quechua. They have been members for 7, 5, and 3 years respectively. In the bank, they have learned to save, how to run their businesses efficiently, and how to be responsible.

Ana Maria is 34 years old. She is a single mother and has one son who is 12 years old. Ana Maria sells grains in the city of Pisco. In Pisco, she buys other products and then sells them in Ayacucho. In addition, Ana Maria sells fresh milk at the market in Ayacucho.

Maria Jesús is 66 years old. She is a widow and has seven children, two of whom are currently living with her. Maria Jesus buys grains at regional markets, grinds them into flour, and then sells the flour in the city of Ayacucho. She used to do this everyday, but due to poor health, now only works occasionally. More often, she now sells candy, cookies, fruits, and juice from her home.

Julia is 66 years old. She is married and has seven children, one of whom lives with her. Julia raises animals, such as cows, pigs, chicken, and guinea pigs, which are eaten in Peru. She then sells them at the local market in Ayacucho. She also sells fresh milk and home-maD. cheeses. In addition, Julia owns a car that her son-in-law drives as a taxi.

Ana Maria, Maria Jesús, and Julia need loans of 600, 300, and 1750 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which will be used to buy fruit, peas, cigarettes, candy, and to pay for car repairs.

Ana Maria, Maria Jesús, and Julia dream of owning land, as well as their own stores. They hope that their children will be professionals and have an easier life.

loans.use: Ana Maria, Maria Jesús, and Julia need loans of 600, 300, and 1750 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be used to buy fruit, peas, cigarettes, candy, and to pay for car repairs.

loans.name: Águeda

texts.es:
Águeda and her husband, Saturnino, are responsible and hard-working parents of seven children. As more children entered their home they were forced to work even harder so their little ones wouldn't feel economic constraints. Águeda leaves her humble home every day at 3 a.m. for the bakery where she makes delicious varieties of bread. During the festivals in the villages around her childhood home, Ayaviri, she happily goes around buying quality cheeses, which eventually form a considerable quantity that she takes back to sell in the cities of Arequipa and Cuzco and also enjoy on her own. While Águeda carries out these businesses, her husband, Saturnino, works very hard as a driver of three-wheeler. Águeda wants to grow her business and sell more breads and cheeses, but needs more capital to carry it out. She turns to your kind heart for help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Águeda y su esposo Saturnino son padres muy responsables y trabajadores de siete hijos. Conforme llegaban más miembros a su hogar tuvieron que esforzarse y trabajar más para que sus pequeños no atraviesen limitaciones económicas.Desde las 3:00 de la madrugada diariamente doña Águeda sale de su humilde hogar rumbo a la panadería en el que elabora deliciosos y variados panes, y durante los días de feria de los pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad natal, Ayaviri, recorre muy contenta y animosa estos lugares comprando agradables y consistentes quesos que luego de acopiar una considerable cantidad los lleva para su venta y degustación a las ciudades de Arequipa y Cuzco.Mientras esta laboriosa madre se esfuerza en estas sus labores, su esposo, Saturnino, trabaja con mucho empeño y voluntad brindando servicio de movilidad en un triciclo a la población de su ciudad.Águeda requiere de mayor capital para invertir en su negocio y ampliar su mercado, es por esa razón que recurre a tu desinteresada ayuda.

loans.use: Increse her income by enlarging her offerings of breads and cheeses / Incremento de capital para acrecentar su producción de panes y oferta de quesos.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia is a hard-working woman with big dreams of transforming her small work space into one of the largest and busiest restaurants in her area. Along with preparing and selling her delicious dishes, she has decided to convert a portion of her small space into a convenience store and sell items of primary necessity and use the extra income to provide for her family. Anastacia carries out her work with much joy because it allows her to afford to educate and care for her two beloved children, who have become her reason to live and motivate her to keep making headway. With the goal of enlarging and remodeling her restaurant, Anastacia is requesting a loan. With your support and her plans, she will be able to earn more income. You can help Anastacia reach her dreams soon.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Anastacia, es una dama muy laboriosa con gran deseo de convertir su pequeño espacio de trabajo en uno de las más grandes y concurridos restaurantes de su zona, adicionalmente a esta labor de venta y preparación de deliciosos potajes, ha decidido adecuar un espacio de su reducido local para la venta de abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad con los que obtiene indispensables ingresos económicos que obtiene para el sustento de su familia.Anastacia desempeña estas labores con mucha voluntad y alegría porque gracias a estos les otorga educación y bienestar a sus dos queridas hijas, quienes se han convertido en su razón de ser y la fuerza que la motiva a seguir adelante. Con el fin de acrecentar y remodelar su restaurante solicita un préstamo que luego de tu gentil colaboración y su buena inversión podrá generar mayores ingresos económicos. Usted puede hacer que doña Anastacia concrete en corto tiempo su anhelo.

loans.use: Enlarge her restaurant and purchase larger quantities of primary-need items for her small convenience store. / Ampliación de su restaurante y compra de mayor cantidad de artículos de primera necesidad para su pequeña bodega.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina comes from a large and humble family from the village of Arapa, Peru. Out of necessity and hunger she was forced to work at a very young age and for this reason never completed her high school eduction. She currently lives with her husband and children in a rented home in the city of Juliaca. Her husband, Raúl, works in the moving services with his three-wheeler, and she started out selling desserts at an outdoor stand. With the little she was able to save she decided to invest in selling second-hand shoes. She started the business with the help of her sisters-in-law, and now with her hard work and dedication she has seen good results. This hard-working and strong mother of four has been hoping to enlarge her business, which is why she turns to you for support. Rufina is grateful for your generous heart.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rufina, proviene de una humilde y numerosa familia del pueblito de Arapa, la necesidad y el hambre la obligaron a trabajar desde muy pequeña y es por esa razón no pudo concluir sus estudios secundarios. Actualmente vive junto a su esposo e hijos en un domicilio alquilado de la ciudad de Juliaca. Su esposo, Raúl, trabaja brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su triciclo, y ella se inició vendiendo dulces en forma ambulatoria.Ahora con el poco ahorro que contaba decidió incursionar e invertir en el negocio de venta de zapatillas de segundo uso. Emprendió este negocio por iniciativa de sus cuñadas, ahora con su empeño, dedicación y buena voluntad va obteniendo buenos resultados.Esta trabajadora y esforzada madre de cuatro hijos tiene pensado ampliar su negocio, razón por la cual recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu ayuda. Rufina agradece de corazón el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Increase her income by offering larger quantities of shoes to her customers / Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de zapatos a los pobladores de su ciudad.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina is a young mother with a 4-year-old son. She makes her living selling second-hand stuffed animals. This hard-working woman went through extreme hardships after her companion left her during her pregnancy. Since then she has tried to make headway and never stopped looking for ways to earn an income, but many times she wasn't able to because of her condition. Fortunately, her young son gave her the strength and courage to carry on. Now, with the support of her beloved aunt Rosa, she has immersed herself in selling her second-hand items, which are brought in from the city and she sells Saturday-Monday at the local market. This exemplary and valiant mother has been planning on enlarging her business and it is for this reason she turns to you in search of support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El negocio de venta de peluches de segundo uso, se está convirtiendo en el ingreso económico más importante de Reina, joven madre de un niño de cuatro años. Esta laboriosa mujer sufrió una gran decepción en la vida, la persona con la que creía formar un hogar la abandonó luego de enterarse que estaba embarazada; desde entonces en todo momento trató de salir adelante buscando un sin fin de maneras para generar sus propios ingresos económicos, y muchas veces su condición no le permitía desenvolverse adecuadamente, afortunadamente su pequeño niño le otorgo mucha fuerza y valor para seguir adelante.Ahora con el apoyo de su querida tía, Rosa, viene incursionando en el negocio de venta de peluches de segundo uso, mercadería que trae por fardos de la ciudad de Bolivia y oferta los días sábados, domingos y lunes en el mercado Dominical de Juliaca.Esta ejemplar y valerosa madre tiene pensado ampliar su negocio y es por eso que recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu ayuda.

loans.use: Increase her income by offering a larger number of stuffed animals / Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor número de bellos peluches.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Ever since he was a young boy Juan has been very hard-working, agile and happy. He inherited these traits from his parents, who were humble people with a strong work ethic that was always dedicated to making bricks. Now Juan has a young son, age 2, himself and is married. He shares the family business with his loving wife and brothers and together they work with the sole objective of doing their best and making headway with the business. The hope of Juan and his wife is to save enough to purchase their own home, and above all be able to provide for their son's education and well-being, as well as take care of their parents. Juan has been planning on buying supplies to make his bricks, and with that end he turns to you in request of a loan. Your kind heart will help Juan and his family carry out their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Juan desde niño siempre fue un muchacho muy trabajador, alegre, y ágil, esos dones los heredó de sus padres, quienes fueron personas humildes pero muy laboriosas que estuvieron dedicados desde siempre a la fabricación de ladrillos. Actualmente Juan tiene un niño de dos años y está casado, comparte el trabajo de familia con su amada esposa y hermanos y todos juntos laboran con un solo objetivo y tratan de dar lo mejor de sí para sacar adelante este negocio que están llevando a cabo en una sociedad familiar.El deseo de Don Juan y su esposa es ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar su propia casita, y sobre todo ofrecerle educación, bienestar, y atención a su hijo y ancianos padres.Él tiene pensado comprar insumos para la fabricación de sus ladrillos, con este fin recurre a ti y hace la solicitud de un préstamo.Vuestro buen corazón permitirá cumplir el proyecto de Juan.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of supplies to make bricks / Compra de mayor cantidad de insumos.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato is a vigorous and hard-working 28-year-old. When he completed high school, he decided to leave his childhood home of Saman, Peru, in search of a better quality of life. He currently resides in Juliaca and makes a living in the moving service with his three-wheeler and is also employed by a local bricklaying business. With his efforts and tireless hours of work he has been able to purchase land to build a small home. His hope is to finish the construction and have his own roof over his head. With this goal in mind, this enterprising young man asks for your support and is grateful for your kind heart.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Fortunato, es un vigoroso y trabajador muchacho de 28 años de edad, cuando concluyó sus estudios secundarios, decidió salir de su pueblo natal, Saman, en busca de mejores condiciones de vida.Actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca y para ganarse la vida trabaja brindando servicios de movilidad en su triciclo y ahora también como empleado en una ladrillera local, con ese esfuerzo y con muchas horas incansables de trabajo ha podido comprar su terreno para construir un cuartito.El deseo de este esforzado muchacho es concluir la construcción de su espacio para tener un techo propio y seguro donde vivir, con ese propósito recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu solidario apoyo y hace la petición de un préstamo.Colaboremos con la solicitud de este emprendedor muchacho, él agradece tu buen corazón.

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish building his home / Compra de materiales para concluir la construcción de su vivienda.

loans.name: Isabel's Group

texts.en:
Isabel, Edelina, and Elizabeth have are members of the “Empecemos” community bank . Isabel and Elizabeth have belonged for over ten years, while Edelina joined eight months ago. In their bank, they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and to save. In addition, they have learned how to educate their children and how to avoid domestic violence.

Isabel is 55 years old. She is married and has four children. Isabel has a printing shop located on the central street of Ayacucho. She started this business with her sons several years ago.

Edelina is 27 years old. She lives with her partner and four year old daughter. Edelina sells sweets. She uses a bicycle cart to transport her goods to sell them all around the city. She has been running this business for three years.

Elizabeth is 39 years old. She is a single mother and has a fifteen-year-old daughter. Elizabeth makes cakes, which she then sells to stores and restaurants. She also takes orders for special events, such as birthdays and weddings. She learned how to bake from her mother.

Isabel, Edelina, and Elizabeth need loans of 1600, 400, and 400 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy a printer, a display case, cookies, caramels, soft drinks, cigarettes, flour, sugar, and butter.

Isabel, Edelina, and Elizabeth dream that their children will be professionals, they will own their homes, and the print shop will have the most up-to-date machinery.

loans.use: Isabel, Edelina, and Elizabeth need loans of 1600, 400, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy a printer, a display case, cookies, caramels, soft drinks, cigarettes, flour, sugar, and butter.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Señora Ana Julia is 37 years of age, lives with her life companion and has 4 children, all of which go to grade and secondary school. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación settlement, a marginalized, very poor, rural neighborhood. The dwellings of the settlers are built of zinc, plastic and/or wood. The area does not have a sewer system. There is a shortage of water and the streets are not paved. The housing conditions of the lady are very humble. She has many limitations due to the fact that she can not rely on having the necessary resources to improve the infrastructure of her dwelling.

Ana Julia’s life companion works in the duty-free zone of operative. The pay that he receives is very little and does not cover even half of the basic food needs of the children. Being in this difficult situation, the lady has decided to rent rooms at low prices to people from other areas, with the objective of having a monthly income and in this way she can meet all the family expenses. With this activity the lady assures that her children will have food. This is how her family will subsist and move forward, despite the difficult economic situation in the country. At this time Ana Julia needs a loan to improve the condition of the rooms that she rents. She wants to refinish the walls, to cover certain holes that they have and to paint them, to give a better appearance to the rooms so that she can come to receive a better income from them.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Julia tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida, tiene 4 hijos, los cuales todos se encuentran estudiando en primaria y secundaria, habita en el asentamiento Villa Reconciliación, un barrio rural, muy pobre, marginado, las viviendas de los pobladores son construidas de zinc, plástico y/o madera, no tiene alcantarillado, existe escasez de agua, las calles no están pavimentadas. Las condiciones habitacionales de la señora es muy humilde, tienen muchas limitaciones debido a que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para mejor la infraestructura de la vivienda.

El compañero de vida de la señora trabaja en la zona franca de operario, el pago que obtiene es muy bajo y alcanza a cubrir ni la mitad de la canasta básica de los alimentos de los niños, viéndose en esta difícil situación, la señora decide alquilar cuartos a personas ajenas a la localidad a precios bajos, con el objetivo de tener ingresos fijos mensualmente y de esta manera pueda asumir todos los gastos familiares. Con esta actividad la señora asegura la alimentación de sus hijos, es así como esta familia subsiste y sale adelante, pese a la dura situación económica en la que se encuentra el país. En estos momentos la señora requiere un préstamo para acondicionar mejor los cuartos que alquila, desea darle un fino a las paredes, tapar ciertos agujeros que poseen y pintarlos, para darle una mejor presentación a los cuartos y pueda llegar a tener una mejor renta de los mismos.

loans.use: To buy blocks, zinc, cement and iron to improve the condition of rooms for rent.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
The beautiful craftmanship of knitting has become Eulalia's main source of income. She's a hard-working mother and very artistic. Her motivation and perseverance have made it possible for her to provide for her family which includes her 4 children and her husband. She has been knitting for about 10 years. At first, she would only knit for friends and neighbors. After hearing praises from them as to how beatiful her clothes was, she decided to do it full-time. Thanks to her patience, agility and skillfulness have made it easier for her to overcome financial difficulties. Dona Eulalia is requsting a loan in order to build a workshop and therefore increase her output.

While Dona Eulalia dedicates her time to knitting, her husband,Siciliano, sells construction tile. The two of them try to give security and tranquility to their loving family. Your assistance can very well help this family increase their quality of living.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El bello arte de tejer se convirtió en el ingreso económico principal de doña Eulalia, madre muy emprendedora y creativa que con habilidad, agilidad y mucho empeño viene sacando adelante a su querida familia conformado por sus 4 hijos y esposo.Ya viene dedicándose a esta labor 10 años, en un principio tejía sólo para sus amigos y vecinos, pero al percibir que sus lindas chalinas, guantes y chullos eran observados complacientemente por sus clientes decidió dedicarse íntegramente a este bello arte. Gracias a su paciencia, agilidad y destreza ha superado con su labor muchos momentos de crisis familiar y en esta oportunidad doña Eulalia requiere obtener un préstamo para implementar su tallercito de tejidos y aumentar la cantidad de sus tejidos.Mientras esta laboriosa madre se desempeña eficientemente en su labor, su esposo, Siciliano, trabaja vendiendo ladrillos de construcción, y entre los dos tratan de brindarles seguridad, bienestar y tranquilidad a su amada familia.Vuestro aporte podría permitir mejorar la calidad de vida de esta encantadora familia.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Her perseverance, willingness and eagerness for a better future are Flor de Maria biggest characteristics. She's a mother of two young children. She has been through a lot of hard times including physical abuse from her first living partner. At that time, it was her first child, Juan who's now 10 years old, who gave her motivation to move ahead. With the savings she had, she decided to purchase a shoe sewing machine and opened a workshop where she put in practice everthing her father had taught her about sewing shoes. Thanks to her hard work, dedication and great workmanship, she has been able to manage a succesful business and was able to built her own house. After 8 years of being separated from her first partner, she decided to give herself a second chance at love. She thought she knew this person, but at the end it didn't work out. She did have a little girl from this relationship. Flor de Maria decided to give herself to her business and to try to make it even more successful.

She has hired 3 workers who give her all the support she needs while she takes care of all the distribution. Due to her huge motivation to move ahead and her huge clientele, she now realizes she needs to request for a loan. "Your assistance will be a good investment in the hands of this hard-working mother."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El empeño, voluntad, y las innumerables ganas de superación de Flor de María, son sus principales características, ella es madre de dos pequeños niños, en el transcurso de su vida ha pasado por muchos momentos de privaciones y angustias, sufrió los maltratos físicos y posterior abandono de su primera pareja, desde entonces solo tenía una razón para progresar su pequeño niño Juan de 10 años.Con los ahorros que tenía decidió comprar una máquina de coser calzados para abrir su taller de fabricación de zapatos poniendo en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos de su padre en esta labor.Gracias a su esfuerzo, perseverancia, sus excelentes trabajos y novedosos modelos de calzados ha logrado tener éxito y ha podido construir su propia casita. Ahora después de ocho años de haberse separado de su primer compromiso decidió darse una segunda oportunidad, creyó conocer a la persona perfecta con el que tuvo una pequeña niña, desafortunadamente las cosas tampoco resultaron y después de este segundo episodio Flor de María está decidida a dar lo mejor de sí para seguir adelante con su pequeño taller de calzados. Poniendo en práctica su proyecto contrató a 3 trabajadores quienes le apoyan en la fabricación de sus hermosos calzados mientras ella se encarga de la distribución al por mayor.Sus inmensos deseos de progreso, la gran cantidad de clientes y el enorme número hacen necesario su solicitud de un préstamo. “Tu aporte desinteresado será una buena inversión en las manos de esta luchadora madre”.

loans.use: To purchase more basic material

loans.name: Magda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Magda is 38 years old, married and has 3 children who attend high school. This family lives in the Sabana Grande area, located near the city's outskirts. This rural region has a temperate climate and semi dry soil. There is no drinking water or paved roads. The majority of its inhabitants earn a living selling fruits, vegetables, grains and meat, among other things. This family leads a very humble life and at the moment has just enough to cover their day to day necessities.

For the past 12 years, Magda and her husband have been earning a living fattening up pigs and selling the meat out of their small home. Their children help them with the housework and also on the business. Magda starts her day at 5:00 AM to set everything up. She does this every day of the week, never taking a day off since she sells the most meat in the mornings. She sells meat retail and wholesale although sometimes she also sells the pigs. Her main clients are homemakers and women who resale meat at the markets. This business is this family's only source of income. Magda needs the loan to buy 6 pigs of 150 Lbs each. She slaughters 2 to 3 pigs per week and currently only has 2 left. This is not enough to meet the amount of meat that she sells daily.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Magda tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos, todos se encuentran estudiando en secundaria, esta familia habita en la comarca Sabana Grande, ubicada en las afueras de la Ciudad, es zona rural, clima fresco, las calles principales o avenidas no están pavimentadas, no tienen agua potable, es semi-árido, la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican al comercio informal de venta de frutas, granos básicos, legumbres, carne entre otras cosas. Esta familia vive humildemente, cuentan con lo necesario para subsistir día a día.

La señora y su esposo tienen 12 años de dedicarse a engordar cerdos, destazar y vender carne del mismo, esta actividad la realizan en su pequeña vivienda, los hijos ayudan a sus padres con el quehacer de la casa y también en el negocio. La señora inicia su jornada de trabajo a las 5: 00 a.m. para preparar su negocio, todos los días de la semana sin descanso, ya que la mejor venta de carne es por la mañana, ella vende carne al detalle y por mayor y también vende los cerdos, las clientas de la señora son en su mayoría las amas de casa y las señoras que comercializan carne en los diferentes mercados. Es con este negocio como esta familia subsiste. La señora necesita un préstamo para comprar 6 cerdos de 150 libras, ya que por semana ella destaza de 2 a 3 cerdos y en estos momentos en existencia solo tiene 2, lo cual es insuficiente para la demanda de carne que vende por día.

loans.use: Purchase of 6 pigs

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a 21 year old young lady who's very talented and a hard worker. She learn how to sew from her cousin, Ninfa. Since Delia is a quick learner, she decided to use her skills for a living. She currently has her own workshop where she makes beautiful and artistic vests and sweaters which she then sells at whole prices in the city of Desaguadero.

Due to the sucess of this business, she has been able to contribute to the family financially and help her parents pay for tuition for her younger sibblings. This lovely young lady dreams of one day having the biggest arts/crafts workshop in her native city of Juliaca. In order to satisfy her clients' demands, she decided to purchase sewing machines and hire 2 workers. She realized that this wasn't enough to satisfy demand since she still needs to buy a great quantity and variety of wool. This is why she's requesting your help!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Delia, es una muchacha de 21 años, ella es una afanosa y talentosa joven que aprendió el bello arte de tejer de su prima Ninfa quien muy complacientemente le transmitió sus conocimientos, gracias a su habilidad e interés la llevaron a poner en práctica rápidamente sus conocimientos adquiridos.Actualmente pese a su corta edad cuenta con su propio taller de tejidos en donde elabora hermosas y novedosas chompas y chalecos que luego los distribuye al por mayor en la ciudad de Desaguadero; su desempeño en esta actividad le está permitiendo cubrir los gastos económicos de su familia y apoyar a sus padres en la educación de sus hermanos menores. El deseo de esta adorable muchacha es convertir su taller en una de las más grandes fábricas de tejidos de su ciudad natal Juliaca. Al observar que tenía una gran cantidad de solicitudes decidió comprar máquinas de coser y contratar a dos colaboradores, pero eso no es suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, requiere adquirir gran variedad de lana para la confección de sus chompas, con ese fin recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu importante ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase basic material for the making of clothing made out of wool

loans.name: Rafaela Esperanza

texts.es:
Ms. Esperanza R. is a small business owner with a lot of experience in retail sales. She has been selling cosmetics, apparel, perfume, and shoes for men, women, and children for 23 years. She started her small business selling only cosmetics, but ultimately was able to expand her business, offering a new line of products. Her customers are primarily people who work and who order products for personal use. She sells her items from home, and on weekends, she travels to the city of Rivas to sell her merchandise in the markets and plazas there.

This single mother has been able to help her only child, who is now studying, get ahead in life. She decided to build an extra room that she can rent in the front of her home as an additional source of income, thus allowing her to travel less to the inland region. This means she no longer has to leave her child under the care of relatives. With this extra income, she will be able to both cover the household expenses and pay for her child’s education. At this time, she still needs to build a wall and a roof, as well as paint the additional room. With this room, she will be able to pay for all the everyday expenditures that she must tackle on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esperanza es una microempresaria que posee una vasta experiencia en las ventas al menudeo, hace 23 años se dedica a vender cosméticos, ropa, zapatos, perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños. Inició su pequeño negocio vendiendo únicamente cosméticos y fue con el tiempo que se fue expandiendo hasta ofrecer nuevas líneas de productos como hasta ahora ofrece, sus clientas son mayormente personas que trabajan y que le encargan productos para uso personal. Es en su casa de habitación que ofrece sus productos y los fines de semana visita el departamento de Rivas a vender su mercadería en los mercados y plazas de esa ciudad.

Es con su negocio como ha sacado adelante esta madre soltera a su único hijo quien se encuentra estudiando. La señora como otra fuente de ingresos que le permita afrontar los gastos y viajar menos al interior del país dejando a su hijo con parientes que lo cuiden decidió construir un cuarto en la parte delantera de su vivienda para alquilarlo y así poder complementar los gastos básicos de la casa y la educación de su hijo, en estos momentos al cuarto le falta levantarle una pared, cerrar el techo y pintar el cuarto, con esto ella se ayudaría a suplir todos los gastos que ella sola afronta

loans.use: Purchase of metal beams, aluminum sheeting, and paint

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es:
Octavio is a very loving and responsible father. He's 27 years old. About 5 years ago, he decided to leave Taraco, the town where he was born, to look for a better job. He left his loving wife and 2 young children behind. When he arrived in the city of Juliaca, he got a job driving a 'tricycle' which he leased so that he can provide local transportation services to the public. With his savings, he bought his own tricycle.

He worked very hard for a period of 4 years so that he could earn enough money to send to his family back home so that they wouldn't go hungry. A few months ago, Octavio was able to purchase a 'moto-taxi' to continue providing transportation services to the public. Now, he's able to make more money for his family. His biggest dream is to one day build a little house in the city so that his family can reunite again. Octavio and his family await your response. Don't let them down.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Octavio, es un amoroso y responsable padre de 27 años de edad, hace 5 años decidió salir de su pueblo natal Taraco en busca de mejores ingresos para su familia, dejando en su pueblo a su amada esposa y a sus 2 menores hijos; cuando llegó a la ciudad de Juliaca inició su propósito trabajando con un triciclo alquilado con el que brindaba servicios de transporte urbano a la población de esa ciudad, luego de ahorrar lo suficiente pudo comprar su propia movilidad, con esa herramienta trabajó arduamente durante 4 años, tratando siempre de esforzarse y sacar el mayor provecho a su actividad con el fin de enviar cierta cantidad de dinero para que su querida familia no pase privaciones.Hace pocos meses Octavio pudo comprar su mototaxi para seguir brindando servicios de movilidad. Con esta herramienta de trabajo está logrando generar mayores ingresos económicos para su familia y su deseo más grande es construir una pequeña casita en esta ciudad para reunir otra vez a su querida familia.Octavio y su familia esperan tu pronta respuesta, no los defraudes ellos confían en ti.

loans.use: To purchase construction material to build a modest home in the city of Juliaca

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda and her husband, Nemesio, have huge inspirations to one day see all their children with a good career and a very bright future. This is why Yolanda and Nemesio work hard each day. Señora Yolanda buys and sells used electronics. She started this business because her husband's salary as a chaufer didn't cover all the family's expenses such as paying for school tuition for all 5 children.

Both jobs have become critical in supporting the well-being and education of their children. Señora Yolanda wishes to have more money to purchase more inventory in the city of Arequipa. She's sure that by increasing her inventory, she will be able to make more of a profit. This is why she's requesting your help.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Las innumerables ganas de ver a sus hijos profesionales y con un futuro promisorio son las razones que tiene Yolanda y su esposo, Nemesio, para esforzarse día a día en sus respectivas actividades. La señora Yolanda está dedicada a la compra y venta de artefactos eléctricos de segundo uso, emprendió este negocio porque el sueldo que su esposo percibe como chofer no cubría sus gastos familiares y la educación de sus 5 queridos hijos.Actualmente ambos trabajos se convirtieron en indispensables para esta familia, gracias a estas actividades y su esfuerzo están logrando brindarles educación y bienestar a sus retoños.El deseo de doña Yolanda es aumentar el monto del capital de su negocio con la compra de mayor cantidad de artículos de la ciudad de Arequipa. Está segura que aumentando su inversión logrará mayores beneficios económicos, con este propósito recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu importante ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory such as used electronics

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel is 20 years old. Out of pure necessity and hunger, he began working when he was 10 years old. This was around the time his parents were having a lot of marital problems and ended up getting a divorce. He was very sad and devastated by this. He used to work at a mechanic shop when he was a little boy. Then, he used to provide transportation services using a tricicle-motor car, which required a lot of physical strength. Now, he has obtain a moto-taxi. He's able to earn more money driving a moto-taxi, and he's able to help his dad support and provide schooling to his 3 younger brothers.

Abel is unable to work in peace because he can't afford to pay for his license renewal and for his membership fee to the transportation company. It's a large sum of money and at this time he has been unable to resolve this problem. He's asking for your help in obtaining this money so that he can be current and work in peace.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Abel es un joven de 20 años de edad, la necesidad y el hambre le obligó a trabajar desde los 10 años de edad cuando sus padres se divorciaron rodeados de muchos problemas, este hecho le causó mucho dolor y decepción.Desde niño trabajó en un taller de mecánica, luego con mucho esfuerzo físico brindó servicios de movilidad en un triciclo y ahora finalmente ha adquirido un mototaxi; con esta herramienta de trabajo está logrando obtener mayores ingresos económicos para apoyar a su padre en la educación y alimentación de sus tres hermanitos menores.El problema de Abel es que no puede trabajar con tranquilidad, porque constantemente recibe notificaciones de la municipalidad de la ciudad de Juliaca solicitándole la renovación de su licencia de conducir y su afiliación a una empresa, este trámite tiene un costo muy alto y no ha podido concluir esta obligación, con el propósito de poner en regla todos y cada uno de las solicitudes de las autoridades de su ciudad recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu ayuda a fin de acopiar la cantidad necesaria para concluir con su deber.

loans.use: To renew his driver's license and to pay for a membership fee to a transportation company in the city

loans.name: Luzdelia

texts.es:
Years ago, Luzdelia's parents were the best weavers in the city of Juliaca. This beautiful craft was the lifeblood of her entire family. With the passage of time, her parents' physical condition didn't allow them to continue working and they were forced to quit the activity, bequeathing their tools and expertise to their beloved daughter Luzdelia. With a lot of diligence she followed in her parents' footsteps. Currently, with a young son of her own, Yonni, she skillfully carries out the work, making a considerable amount of decorative clothing articles to sell at the Laguna Temporal market in Juliaca. While Luzdelia engrosses herself in her work, her husband works as a miner very far away from their hometown. The wish of this young mother is to acquire wool and thread to continue weaving excellent items with her soft and skilled hands.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Los padres de Luzdelia hace algunos años atrás fueron los mejores tejedores de la ciudad de Juliaca, este bello arte fue el sustento de toda su familia, con el transcurso del tiempo la condición física de sus padres ya no les permitía desempeñar adecuadamente, es por eso que decidieron dejar esta actividad, heredando sus herramientas de trabajo y conocimientos a su querida hija Luzdelia quien con mucha constancia viene siguiendo los pasos de sus padres.Actualmente Luzdelia en compañía de su pequeño niño, Yonni, viene desempañándose muy hábilmente en esta labor, luego de reunir una considerable cantidad de artículos los procede a vender en el mercado Laguna Temporal de la ciudad de Juliaca. Mientras Luzdelia se desenvuelve en esta su labor su esposo trabaja como obrero en una mina muy lejana de su ciudad natal.El deseo de esta joven madre es adquirir materia prima para seguir tejiendo con sus ágiles y hábiles manos sus excelentes prendas de vestir.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of wool and thread / Compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is a very diligent mother with big plans for her business. For the past five years she has been dedicated to the buying and selling of second-hand shoes, which she acquires in bundles from the city of Tacna and sells in the cities of Cusco and Juliaca. She carries out this work with the support of her husband, Walter, and it's generating an important economic source for them, allowing them to provide for the well-being and education of their two young children, who are the reason and motivation to keep working hard. Norma, seeing a great demand for her business, wants to increase her stock, and for this reason is requesting the loan. With your support, Norma thinks she will be able to improve her financial situation even more.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Norma es una madre muy empeñosa y con grandes planes para su negocio, desde hace 5 años está dedicada a la compra y venda de zapatillas de segundo uso, mercadería que adquiere por fardos de la ciudad de Tacna y los oferta en la ciudad de Cusco y Juliaca. Este oficio que desempeña con apoyo de su esposo, Walter, les está generando una importante rentabilidad económica, permitiéndole brindar bienestar, educación y un techo propio a sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son la razón y el motivo que los impulsa a seguir esforzándose.Doña Norma viendo la gran demanda del mercado, decidió aumentar la cantidad de su stock es por esa razón que tiene pensado acrecentar su capital de inversión, ella considera que con tu apoyo y su voluntad mejorarán aún más sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Offer customers a large selection of shoes / Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de zapatos a la población en general.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina, is a hardworking woman. Despite her age she continues to work with much enthusiasm, dedication and willingness as she did when she was young. With that same determination and energy, she alone educated her 8 children whom are now older and independent. Alejandrina is from the city of Lampa, but has lived in Juliaca for the last 40 years. Upon arriving to this city she began her business selling American clothing and little by little with her earnings she made changes to her home and opened a small general store. With these 2 businesses she has been able to provide her children a good life. Currently this model woman shares her home with her youngest daughter who is studying at a very recognized university in Juliaca. The desire of Mrs. Alejandrina is to grow and diversify her merchandise. This adorable lady believes these changes will bring about better profits. Your help will permit Alejandrina to continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina, es una mujer muy hacendosa, pese a su avanzada edad sigue trabajando con el mismo entusiasmo, empeño y voluntad que cuando era joven, con ese mismo ánimo y predisposición ha educado sola a sus ocho queridos hijos, quienes ahora ya son mayores e independientes.Alejandrina es natural de la ciudad de Lampa, desde hace cuarenta años radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, al llegar a dicha ciudad inició su labor comercial vendiendo ropa americana, y poco apoco con sus ganancias en su desempeño ha refaccionado su casita y a aperturado su pequeña bodeguita de abarrotes, con estos dos negocios ha podido mantener sin privaciones a sus queridos hijos.Actualmente esta ejemplar madre comparte su vivienda con su menor hija, quien estudia en una universidad muy destacada de la ciudad de Juliaca; el deseo de Doña Alejandrina es ampliar y aumentar el stock de su mercadería, esta adorable dama considera que con los cambios que realice su bodeguita obtendrá mejores ingresos. Vuestra ayuda permitirá que Alejandrina siga floreciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Improving and remodeling her small store.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora, is a woman who has suffered many economical challenges in her life. Immediately after completing her high school education she began working and earning money to help her parents support the family and provide education to her 2 younger brothers. When everything was going well in her life she met Juan, the father of her son Yimi, whom she thought she would build a life with full of love, but without explaination, Juan disappeared. From then on, Flora has dedicated herself to her business buying and selling used sneakers with much perseverence. She brings them in bundles from the city of Tacna. She then fixes them up to sell them in Cuzco and Juliaca. This model mother works day in and day out with just on objective, to give her son comfort, security and education so that he may not have to experience the same economic hardships and enjoy his childhood. In this opportunity, Flora pleads to your good heart and grant her a loan to use as working capital. Flora and her little boy wait for your helping hand.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Flora, es una mujer que ha sufrido muchas privaciones económicas en la vida, inmediatamente después de haber concluido sus estudios secundarios se puso a trabajar y a generar sus propios ingresos para apoyar a sus padres en la manutención y educación de sus hermanos menores, cuando todo marchaba bien en su vida conoció a Juan padre de su hijo Yimi con quien creía formaría un hogar lleno de amor, pero sin ninguna explicación Juan desapareció, desde entonces Flora se dedica con mucha más perseverancia a su negocio de compra y venta de zapatillas usadas, mercadería que trae por fardos de la ciudad de Tacna que luego de arreglarlas las oferta en las ciudades de Cuzco y Juliaca.Esta ejemplar madre se esfuerza día a día con un solo objetivo, brindarle comodidad, seguridad y educación a su hijo, con el fin de que su pequeño retoño no pase privaciones económicas y pueda disfrutar tranquilamente de su niñez. En esta oportunidad Flora recurre a tu buen corazón y hace la petición de un préstamo para utilizarlos como capital de trabajo.“Flora y su pequeño niño esperan tu respuesta favorable”

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more shoes and sneakers

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora dedicates herself to selling regional vegetables at her stand in the Micaela market. She has a large number of customers because of the attention she gives them and the fresh “just picked” quality of her vegetables. Additionally, she sells cold beverages such as sodas and beer from her home where her dear daughter helps her. She is 52 years old and now only enjoys the company of her youngest daughter who is 15. She provides her daughter with all that is necessary to continue studying to allow herself a good future. The desire of this working mother is to improve her two workplaces to allow for additional comfort for her customers and for this reason she looks to you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teodora se dedica a la venta de verduras regionales en un puesto del mercado Micaela, ella tiene una gran acogida de clientes ya que les brinda una buena atención y sobre sus productos son ofertados frescos como recién cosechados; adicionalmente a este negocio vende en su casa bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas), contando con la importante ayuda de su querida hija.Ella tiene 52 años y ahora solo goza de la compañía de la menor de sus hijas de 15 años de edad, a quién le da lo necesario para que siga estudiando para que pueda forjarse un buen futuro.El deseo de esta trabajadora madre es implementar sus dos centros trabajo para mayor comodidad de sus clientes y por esta razón recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu ayuda.

loans.use: Improving her business

loans.name: Yesica

texts.en:
With many hopes and dreams to form a home full of love and affection, Yesica decided to join Roger, a young motivate musician. She is 21 years old and is from the Sandia province but due to work she now lives in Juliaca. Since she began her family 9 months ago she began to dedicate herself to knitting beautiful outfits. She learned this artistic skill from the instruction of her sister-in-law Begilia, who taught her with much patience and diligence. Yesica would like to concentrate fully on this work and therefore needs to purchase more variety of materials (wool) for the creation of her products. With this intent, she requests from you your help to fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Con muchas ilusiones y la esperanza de formar un hogar donde reine el amor y el cariño, Yesica, decidió unirse con Roger, joven emprendedor dedicado a la música. Ella tiene 21 años de edad y es natural de la provincia de Sandia pero por circunstancias de trabajo radica en Juliaca.Desde que formó su familia hace más de 9 meses decidió dedicarse al tejido de hermosas prendas de vestir, bello arte que aprendió gracias a las instrucciones de su cuñada Begilia quien le transmitió con mucha paciencia y diligencia sus conocimientos, que ahora Yesica con agilidad y habilidad desempeña.El deseo de Yesica es dedicarse completamente a esta labor es por eso que requiere comprar gran cantidad y variedad de materia prima (lana) para la elaboración de su mercadería, con este propósito recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu ayuda.Con vuestra ayuda Yesica cristalizará sus deseos.

loans.use: Purchase a larger quantity and variety of materials.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza E. is a married mother of one child, who attends elementary school. She lives in the La Fuente neighborhood, located in the urban part of the city. Her husband owns a taxi and works 8-hour shifts 7 days a week. This is how this small family helps each other out. For six years, Maritza has been working in a snack bar at the Rene Shick School, where she waits on not only the students of the school, but also the teachers, from 6:30 am to 6:30 pm.

She serves soft drinks, snacks, home cooked meals, sandwiches, fruit, and juice, among other items. The school year started in the beginning of February, which is why she needs to buy more products. Since the last day of classes was in December, she no longer has any products to offer. She would like to restock her kiosk as soon as possible with everything she requires in order to meet her customer’s needs. She needs to buy the products that both the students and teachers consume.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maritza esta casada, tiene un hijo pequeño que se encuentra estudiando en primaria, habita en el barrio La Fuente, este sector se encuentra en la parte urbana de la ciudad. El esposo de la señora es propietario de un taxi, él mismo lo trabaja en turnos de 8 horas, todos los días a la semana, es así como esta pequeña familia se ayudan mutuamente, la señora hace 6 años trabaja en un kiosco del Colegio Rene Shick, el cual atiende a todos los alumnos de la mañana y la tarde en horarios de 6:30 am a 6: 30 pm, así como los docentes que imparten las clases en el Centro Escolar.

Ella ofrece bebidas gaseosas, golosinas, comidas casera, sándwich, frutas, refrescos naturales, entre otras cosas. El año lectivo escolar empiezó a inicios de Febrero, por lo cual la señora necesita comprar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, ya que desde Diciembre que fue el último día de clases, la señora no cuenta con ningún producto en existencia. Como la fecha esta muy próxima, la señora desea abastecer su kiosco lo más pronto posible con todo lo necesario para enfrentar la demanda de sus clientes. Ella necesita comprar a sus proveedores los productos que consumen tanto los alumnos como los maestros y así poder contar con todo lo necesario.

loans.use: Restock her snack bar

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
The sale of cold drinks (beer and soda) is the daily activity that Mrs. Estrella carries out. She is fighting to get ahead and to progress with this business. She is 56 years old. With the help of her husband, Jose, who is an independent worker and always helps out with everything, she was wants to keep getting ahead and her dream is to implement him to construct a kiosk to offer more comfort to her clients. Your help is very important for the crystallization of this dream. Estrella appreciates it very much.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

La venta D. bebidas heladas(cervezas y gaseosas), es la actividad diaria que desempeña la señora Estrella, quien lucha por salir adelante y progresar con este su negocio, ella tienen 56 años D. edad. Con la ayuda D. su esposo, José, quien es trabajador independiente y siempre la apoya en todo, quiere seguir surgiendo y su deseo es implementarlo y construir un kiosco para brindar una mejor comodidad a sus clientes. Vuestra ayuda ese muy importante para la cristalización D. este deseo, Estrella te lo agradece.

loans.use: Implementation of her business

loans.name: Kathy

texts.es:
Kathy is 33 years old, and has 2 kids 13 and 9 years old, Frida and Cristian. They mean a lot to her and above all their progress motivates her. Kathy is a fun-loving woman and when she sells her cold drinks to her clients she provides a very friendly and charismatic service, which is the most important to her. Her husband Luis works selling petroleum to boats in the ports. He helps her a lot in all of her decisions and above all in this business. She also sells clothing for country homes of the Ucayali river. Her goal is to increase her quality of life and make the family business better. She hopes the help from your kind heart.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Kathy de 33 años de edad, tiene 02 hijos de 13 y 09 años de edad de nombres Frida y Cristian, quienes significan mucho para ella y sobre todo se han convertido en el importante motivo de su progreso. Kathy es una mujer súper jovial, pues cuando vende sus bebidas heladas a sus clientes lo hace con mucha amabilidad y carisma ya que la calidad de servicio es lo más importante para ella. Su esposo Luis trabaja vendiendo petróleo a las embarcaciones del puerto y la apoya mucho en todas sus decisiones y sobre todo en este su negocio, ella de manera adicional vende prendas de vestir por los caseríos del río Ucayali.Y su esforzado desempeño tiene el propósito de incrementar su calidad de vida y negocio familiar.Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: Implementation of her business

loans.name: Marilu

texts.en:
Marilu, a thirty-year-old mother of four school-going children, sells diced pork in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo. She has been running this business for four years.

Marilu explains that the business is gainful and the clientele is growing. Currently, she has a monthly profit of about USD 200.00. Marilu will use her loan to invest in the purchase of more meat to keep satisfy her clientele’s needs. She says that she will work for the sake of her family as far as possible.

loans.use: To purchase pork to resell in her community

loans.name: Sención

texts.en:
Sención is thirty years old and sells fresh pork meat in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo. She joyfully says that her business is very profitable and that the meat is sold as just rapidly as she can purchase it wholesale.

Sención explains that, during the past ten years, she has been able to fend for her three children by means of the business. Now, she plans on putting asiD. money to support the forthcoming university studies of her eldest son. This entrepreneur also is thinking about hiring a employee to help her run the business. She will use her loan to supply her business.

loans.use: To purchase fresh pork meat for a small business.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
The daily work of Felicita is to get herself up very early to prepare what is necessary for her little business, a bird food store.

She started 20 years ago as a traveling salesperson. Little by little the business has been growing thanks to her efforts and persistence. Now her business is located in a stand inside of a market place, which offers her a better sense of security. Thanks to her work she can now offer her kids the opportunity to study, and finish the construction of their home.

Her plan is to buy her stand since she is still renting it, and for that she would need the amount of $1000.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

La labor diaria de Felicita es levantarse desde muy temprano a preparar lo necesario para su pequeño negocio, una tienda de alimentos para aves. Ella empezó hace más de veinte años como vendedora ambulante. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo y empeño. Ahora su negocio se ubica en un puesto dentro del mercado, lo que la hace sentirse más segura que antes.Gracias a su trabajo ella puede brindarle estudios a sus hijos y terminar de construir su vivienda. En sus planes esta la compra de su puesto, ya que este es alquilado aún. Para ello, ella necesitaría un monto de $1000.

loans.use: Purchase of a vending stand inside a market place

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette lives with her husband and seven children in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo. She has been selling men’s and women’s clothing for five years. Jeanette has her stall in the public market, and many people visit her stall every day to purchase her goods. However, Sunday has the most activity and sales because is the principal market day. This entrepreneur has requested a loan to expand her business.

Jeanette is a trustworthy person. About five months ago, she took a loan from our organization and used it wisely. She managed to improve her business and repaid the loan successfully. With this new loan, Jeanette will be able to better help her large and needy family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing in bulk in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Around about 3 years ago, Veronica’s home suffered an economic crisis. Her husband’s work became insufficient to maintain their home, where the two of them with their three kids reside.

It is for this reason that veronica, thanks to the income from working and the enthusiasm from her friend, she decided to sell lunches from a small stand outside of her house. Her business has been functioning for 3 years and getting bigger as time goes on. Today she has expanded into a small store and take out food. Veronica hopes to open a facility inside her house and convert it into a big restaurant where she can receive more clients and work better.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombard, Kiva volunteer

Alrededor de hace tres años, el hogar de Verónica sufría una crisis económica. El trabajo de su esposo ya no era suficiente para el mantenimiento de su hogar, el cual lo conforma ellos dos y sus tres hijos.

Es por esta razón que Verónica, gracias a sus ganas de trabajar y a los ánimos de una amiga suya, decidió empezar a vender almuerzos en un pequeño puesto afuera de su casa.

su negocio tiene aproximadamente dos años y cada vez va creciendo más. Hoy cuenta con una pequeña tienda y los implementos básicos de un "restaurante al paso".

Verónica anhela abrir un local dentro de su casa y convertirlo en un restaurante grande donde pueda recibir más clientes y trabajar mejor.

loans.use: Construct a location for her restaurant

loans.name: Celita

texts.en:
Celita, a forty year old woman and mother of seven children, sells an assortment of perfumes, deodorants, hand and body lotion, and men's and women’s clothing, in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo. She operates her business predominantly in her house, but also she visits people in the neighborhood to sell her products.

This entrepreneur plans to use her loan to add new products to her inventory. She will buy new brands of perfumes and deodorants to attract new customers and increase her income. Celita’s business is the main source of income of the family.

loans.use: To purchase goods to restock a small business.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
Argentina is a multifaceted entrepreneur and a very organized person. She sells fresh pork meat in the morning and men’s and women’s clothing in the afternoon. Argentina is a single mother, and by means of these activities, she supports her five children.

This entrepreneur wants to expand her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase clothing in bulk. She will also buy the fresh meat of other animals, such as chicken and cows, to add to her inventory. Argentina says that her most important value is to work for the sake of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk and to purchase fresh meat to supply her two businesses.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Ever since Claudia started with a small table outside of her house serving ceviche (a typical Peruvian seafood dish) her dream has been to have a big restaurant. In reality, she takes care of everything in her restaurant. It is ample sized location where ceviche and other seafood dishes is served for lunch, and typical Peruvian dishes at night. Claudia is filled with joy at the site of what she has achieved up until now, but she still feels there is much to be done. In spite of the hard work she has already put forth, it seems as though it has filled her with more ambition. To date, she is looking to amplify her location and buy new furniture (tables, chairs, shelves, etc)

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

El sueño de Claudia de tener un gran restaurante se fue cumpliendo desde que un día, contando tan solo con una pequeña mesa, se dispuso a vender ceviche fuera de su casa. En la actualidad, ella maneja todo un restaurante. Un amplio local donde vende ceviche y platos marinos en el almuerzo y platos tipicos peruanos por la noche. Claudia se llena de felicidad al ver lo que ha logrado hasta ahora, pero aún siente que tiene mucho por hacer. Y por el contrario, los cuatros años de continuo esfuerzo parecen haberla llenado de más fuerza. Hoy en dia, ella está en busca de ampliar su local y comprar nuevos muebles (mesas sillas, estantes, etc).

loans.use: Purchase new furniture for her restarant

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a young entrepreneur and mother of three children who is fighting to lift her family out of poverty. A few months ago, she took an FSMA loan, and used it to open a small business selling fried bananas, potatoes, spicy pork sausage, and natural juices in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo.

Susana explains that her business supports her children. She also explains that she has to increase her income to fend for her youngest son, born just two weeks ago.

With her second loan, Susana wants to buy raw materials and other goods to move her business forward. With this loan, the entrepreneur will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of raw materials and other goods for a small business.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona sells fresh meat and operates a small cafeteria in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo. Ramona is forty-two years old and she has two daughters, ages sixteen and twenty years old. The girls attend school. Ramona is recently separated from her husband, and now she has to provide food and look after her daughters on her own.

This entrepreneur defines herself as a persistent and courageous woman, and she says she will persevere until she achieves her main goal, which is to buy a house where her family can live comfortably. Ramona wants to keep supporting her daughters’ university studies until they graduate and can sustain themselves.

Ramona will use her loan to buy raw materials to keep producing food for her customers.

loans.use: To buy food for her cafe

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The old business of selling clothing only generated losses for Nancy while she was part of it. A lack of consultation and competition made it difficult. However, she has learned a lot since then and now. For a year and a half she has kept busy with her little food stand in her neighborhood market. Her day starts very early and she starts with the most necessary tasks for breakfast and lunch. Only being 28 years old in addition to working everyday she is responsible for taking care of her children. Now, with the awaited birth of her other child, she has many expectations in the growth of her business. She would love to be able to diversify the products on her shelves to be able to better attend to her costomers.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

El antiguo negocio de venta de ropa solo le generaba pérdidas a Nancy el tiempo que estuvo en él. Ya sea por la falta de asesoría o por la gran competencia a la cual se enfrentaba. Sin embargo, ella dice haber aprendido mucho de ello y ahora, desde hace año y medio, se ocupa de atender su pequeño puesto de comida en un mercado de su barrio. Su jornada empieza muy temprano, ya que debe preparar ella sola lo necesario para los desayunos y almuerzos que vende. Con tan solo 28 años ella, además de trabajar todos los dias, se encarga de cuidar a sus dos hijos. Ahora, con el pronto nacimiento de su otro hijo, tiene muchas más expectativas en el crecimiento de su negocio. A ella le gustaría poder surtir de diversos productos el estante de su tienda para atender mejor a su clientela.

loans.use: Spur her business with more products and to better  the condition of her stand.

loans.name: Dominica

texts.es:
Dominica has been selling ceviche — a popular local fish dish — for twelve years. Before moving to her current home she sold ceviche at another place located in the northern part of the city. She saw a better business opportunity in this current location, which is why she moved four years ago. She had to start over again with nothing, but she came anyway because she thought it would be better. And so it has.

Shortly after opening her small restaurant, people started to come, every time more than before. Although now she enjoys a good clientele, she is still not satisfied with what she has achieved. Her goal is to expand her restaurant, putting in place a better infrastructure so she can make more earnings.

In this way, with the help of her four children, she would begin to collect the necessary supplies to start construction of her dream — installing a textile shop to make clothes to sell at wholesale in the future.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de la venta de ceviches Dominica lo tiene desde doce años atrás. Antes de mudarse a su actual vivienda ella vendía ceviches en otro lugar ubicado más al norte de la ciudad.

Al ver una mejor oportunidad del negocio en el distrito donde vive ahora, se mudo hace cuatro años. Tendría que volver a empezar de cero. No obstante, ella pensó que le iría mejor. Y así fue.

Al poco tiempo de inaugurar su pequeño restaurante la gente empezó a llegar cada vez más. Aunque ella ahora goza de una buena clientela, aún no se siente satisfecha con lo logrado. Su objetivo es ampliar el local, construir una mejor infraestructura y obtener una ganacia mayor de ello.

De este modo, y con la ayuda de sus cuatro hijos, empezaria a recaudar lo necesario para empezar a construir su sueño de instalar un taller textil para producir ropa y venderla al por mayor en el futuro.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
After being removed from her sales outpost in the central market, Adela decided to open a shop out of her home. She had sold clothing at the commercial center since 1999, and two years ago was when she started her own clothing store. The strides Adela has made have been admirable, and to think her business has grown through the work of only one hard-working and enterprising woman. But she does not consume herself with her store all day; she also makes sure that her three young daughters are never in need of anything. What would help her financially would be adding more items to sell and remodeling her store, for which she is requesting a $1,000 loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

A causa del desalojo que Adela sufrió con su puesto ambulante en un centro comercial, decidio abrir una tienda en su casa. Desde el año 1999 ella vendia ropa en aquel centro comercial y hace dos años lo hace en su propia tienda. Es admirable ver las ganas que Adela pone en su trabajo. Y ver cuánto ha crecido solo hace pensar que es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. A ella no le importa ocuparse todo el dia en su tienda con tal de ver que a sus hijas tres menores hijas no le falten nada. Lo que mejor podria hacer de obtener un financiamiento es implementar su tienda con más productos y mejores inmuebles, para ello necesita $1000.

loans.use: Convert her clothing shop into a convenience store, selling all types of products / Convertir su tienda en bazar, vendiendo todo tipo de productos.

loans.name: Saboat

texts.en:
A. Saboat is 57 years old.

Saboat is a seamstress who sews national dresses. She has been in this business for the last 25 years. The national dresses are very beautiful and popular in Tajikistan. Any girl has a number of the national dresses in her dowry and any woman possesses these beautiful dresses for various occasions. So Saboat has lots of clients. At the same time she has students whom she is training in her house.

Saboat is planning to expand her business and to take more students. For this she shall need to purchase a couple of sewing machines. Moreover, Saboat believes that after expanding her business she shall be able to generate sufficient income to be able to open a private tailoring shop.

For these purposes Saboat requests 3000.00 Somoni (875.00 US dollars) for the term of 12 months. Having proved herself as a reliable client Saboat promises to pay the current loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines and open a tailoring shop.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
K. Shahlo is 37 years old. She is married with three children.

Shahlo sells such goods as batteries, blades, machine twists and threads, pens and other goods. She has been in this business for 13 years. Shahlo's husband helps and supports her always. Like any mother, Shahlo dreams that her kids will have higher education, and that is why she is working hard. The business is successful, bringing considerable income to the family.

Shahlo wants to expand her business and increase working capital in order to purchase new goods for selling. For this purpose she requests 2100.00 Somoni (625.00 US dollars) for the term of 4 months. Having received IMON loans several times already and having demonstrated herself as a good client, Shahlo promises to manage this loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Expanding business and increasing the working capital for purchasing new goods.

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en:
M. Yunus is 37 years old. He is married and has three children.

Yunus has provided transportation services for the last 15 years. Each day on his lorry he transports the goods of his clients. Yunus dreams his children will be educated people so he is working hard. As a result, the business generates significant income allowing him to support his family.

Currently Yunus needs to purchase spare parts for his lorry. For this purpose he requests 2000.00 Somoni (600.00 US dollars) for the term of 12 months. Although this is his first loan Yunus is sure he shall pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of spare parts for the lorry.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
R. Manzura is 42 years old. She is married with two children. The husband of Manzura is a teacher and does not earn much, which is why Manzura, with the support of her husband, decided to run her own business. For 14 years she has been selling foodstuffs like candies, pastries and other confectioneries, as well as sausages in the local market. Manzura says that for several years IMLF IMON supported her by providing additional funding.

This year is very important for Manzura as her elder daughter shall graduate from school and is going to enter the University. Being a loving mother, Manzura wants to support her daughter. In order to do so, she is planning to expand her business and increase the working capital for purchasing foodstuffs. Manzura plans to spend the extra income to pay the fees for her daughter's education.

For this purpose Manzura requests 2500.00 Somoni (725.00 US dollars) for the term of 4 months. Having proved herself a reliable, honest client Manzura promises to pay the loan on time and thanks all for supporting her.

loans.use: Expanding business and increasing capital for purchasing foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mirkarim

texts.en:
S. Mirkarim has just turned 60. He and his wife raised three children.

For 25 years Mirkarim had been involved in manufacturing wooden doors and window frames. Mirkarim's son helps his father in the business. Mirkarim is respected and known in the neighborhood as a real master, and that gains him clientele. The business is stable, generating the main income for the family.

Mirkarim needs to purchase input materials like lumber for his business. Also, he is planning to improve the working conditions of the business. For this purpose Mirkarim requests 2000.00 Somoni (600.00 US dollars) for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan for Mirkarim and he thanks all who support him for their trust.

loans.use: To purchase lumber and improve working conditions.

loans.name: Bahtiyer

texts.en: O. Bahtiyer was born in 1976 in the Asht region of  Tajikistan and he is married and has 2 children. Mr.O. became the client of the MicroInvest in 2008 because a friend told him how it helped him grow his business. He applied to MicroInvest for a business development loan to improve his business. Mr.O. has a home business of raising and selling livestock. He has a large flock and a pedigree bull. He is also a taxi driver. Now Mr.O. requests the loan of 2200 STJ for 8 months to purchase additional livestock.

loans.use: Purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Sabur

texts.en:
U. Sabur is 56 years old. He is married and his two grown-up sons help him in his business.

Sabur runs a private shop manufacturing wooden doors, window frames and also certain items of furniture. He is in this business for 20 years and his two sons are also involved in the business. Through his years of work Sabur has obtained the reputation of the best carpenter in his neighborhood, so the family business is quite stable generating the main income and allowing Sabur to support his family. 

Now Sabur is planning to repair his shop, thus improving the working conditions. He also shall purchase lumber. For this purpose he requests 3460.00 Somoni (1000.00 US dollars) for the term of 12 months. As this is his first loan, Sabur thanks all for the trust in him and his business.

loans.use: Improving the conditions of the shop and purchasing materials like lumber.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: E. Manzura was born in 1970 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 6 children. Mrs. E. started her business from scratch. She applied to  MicroInvest for a business development loan and it permitted her to grow the business and to open her own trade outlet. She buys material from Khujand and sells it in the bazaar in Asht. She has had her business for about 6 years. Now Mrs. E. requests the loan of 2200 STJ to purchase new material.

loans.use: Purchase new material

loans.name: Boihon

texts.en:
N. Boihon is 32 years old. He is married with two children.

Boihon bakes the national bread which is called “lepeshka”. He has been in this business for 12 years already. His bakery is located in his house. As a rule Boihon bakes about 420 “lepeshkas” per day and sells them the same day. The “lepeshka” of Boihon are very popular in his neighborhood and his stable business generates the main income for the family.

Now Boihon is planning to open another bakery, and he also needs to increase the working capital in order to purchase the input materials like flour, salt and coal. For this purpose he requests 600.00 US dollars for the term of 10 months. With the generated income Boihon plans to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchasing materials like, flour, salt and coal and opening another "lepeshka" bakery.

loans.name: Ohunjon

texts.en: N. Ohunjon lives in the Asht region and he is married and has 4 children. Mr.N. is a teacher by the profession but the business that brings his family income is raising and selling livestock.  Now Mr.N. requests the loan of 2500 STJ to purchase a pedigreed milking cow.  This will permit him and his wife to manufacture milk-sour products and sell them to the local trade outlets.

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru:
Nargiza G. is 28 years old, is divorced and has 2 children. She lives separately from her parents. She owns 12 rams and 1 cow. She is very interested increasing the number of animals she owns. She milks the cow herself, sells part of the milk and uses the rest to feed her children. Because animals currently sell for cheap, she would like to borrow money to purchase more animals and resell the summer time. She also works at home making yarn from wool. She would be happy to try using a loan as source of investment.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Гуфранова Наргиза возрост 28 лет , имеет 2их детей,разведена.Сейчас живет самостоятельно от родителей.Имеет 12 баранов и 1 корову.Очень заинтересована в размножении скота.Сама доит корову с которой имеет молоко ,также помимо продажи в своей махале она кормит своих детей им. Т,к, сейчас на базарах дешевый скот она хочет взяв займ купить еще скот и где-то летом продать его. Также она на дому подрабатывает по производству пряжи из бараньей шерсти. Она была бы рада попробовать использовать займ.

loans.use: Cattle raising

loans.name: Ulugbeck

texts.en: K. Ulugbeck was born in 1967 in the J.Rasulov region and he is married and has 3 children.   He sells his products at the nearby bazaar where his store is located. He has an assortment of meat products, canned food, spices and small wares that he sells at competitive prices. Now Mr. K. Ulugbeck requests the loan of 2500 STJ for 5 months to purchase a specialized refrigerator and increase his inventory (he wants to sell milk-sour products).

loans.use: To purchase a specialized refrigerator and increase his inventory

loans.name: Kemflia

texts.ru:
Kemflia lives in a village in the Saatli region in the republic of Azerbaijan. She is 32 years old, married and has 2 children. Together with her brother (see picture), she has purchased a little truck and began selling fruits and vegetables. Each morning she travels to nearby villages with her husband purchasing goods, brings them to the city, rents a spot on the market and sells the produce at a price that is about 20-25% higher than the purchase price was. Because her start up capital is very small, she is unable to increase the profit from her business, which makes it difficult to provide for her family. This is why she came to "Normicro" - a partner of Kiva - asking to borrow $600.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Кемфля, жительница пригорода Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенного в Закавказском регионе, проживает в крестьянской семье. Ей 32 года, замужем , имеет двоих детей. В месте со своим братом (см. фото), купив небольшой грузовичок, она начала приторговывать фруктами и овощами. Каждое утро она со своим мужем ездит по деревням, закупая товар с огородов, привозит их в город, и арендуя на местном рынке место, продаёт купленный товар, накладывая на него приблизительно 20-25% от закупленной стоимости. Имея малую сумму капитала в бизнесе, она не может увеличить прибыль, чтобы обеспечить многодетную семью. Поэтому она обратилась в местный филиал микро кредитной организации "Нормикро" - партнёра КИВА - с заявлением о предоставлении ей кредита суммой в 600 долларов.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Usubali

texts.en: Usubali is a 52-year-old widower with three children. He is a farmer. He lives with his family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan.
